text: We have really enjoyed the Melissa & Doug products that we have bought over the years. However, this costume set could use some modifications. We bought two sets, one for our four year old and another for our two year old. Within one month one of the megaphones stopped working (we tried changing the batteries). They are a cheap plastic and I'm sure that it broke from being dropped, but this should be adjusted for in the design since it is made for children. And, the straps that hold the fire extinguisher and megaphone on the jacket are shredding because they get caught on the velcro closures. The most durable part of the whole set is the fire hat. It is a good heavy plastic and it is withstanding daily repeated use.

text: This is a great costume! All you need to do is add boots and you're set - everything else is included. The fit is snug, but not overly tight. Your cleavage will definitely be on display. If you don't like that look you'll want to put a piece of lace or other material in the "v". Your butt will also be pretty prominent, so again if you don't want that you can cover it with a skirt or larger scarf than what is provided.As other reviewers have noted, the red strips of material will fall down if not fastened. I used a glue gun to keep them in place and that worked fine. It just takes a little time to get them right then glue them.I only wore the mask for a few minutes because I didn't like breathing in my own breath. It looks good for pictures though!Overall I highly recommend this costume if you want a slinky look. Once you have it on it's really comfortable except for having to use the bathroom. That takes a while since it is a jumpsuit. But I felt good all night and never felt like I had to constantly adjust it, like you do for some costumes.

text: I just love my big ole dinosaur costume! Why did I buy it? just because it makes me happy and is so stinking cute....that and possibly a mid-life crisis since I am 55 years old. I decided to scare my BFF (a cop) the night after I got it when he was getting out of his car. I was waiting behind the house and once I was sure he didn't have his gun I came out from the dark making what I percieved to be dinosaur noises. Being a bit of a crabby guy, he just kept getting stuff out of the car while never taking his eyes off of me and looking at me like I was an alien. Then after I made a couple of somewhat inappropriate advances towards him as he was trying to walk in the house he couldn't help but smile.  The next afternoon I put it on again and started doing lunges, squats, running in place in the livingroom. Try as he might, he just couldn't take his eyes off of me or keep a straight face.  I plan to wear it around my yard this weekend and wear it to work in the near future. This is a must have for any woman's wardrobe!

text: I absolutely love this costume! Great cut , well made and sooo flattering . I am 5' 6" and weigh 135 lbs and I bought a medium and it's perfect . I want to go incognito so this is perfect with the face mask and hood . I bought a leather utility belt to wear with it so my friends don't recognize ( and I don't have to carry ) my purse . I wrapped the red ties around my leg a couple times and then once around my waist on each side . They are long enough to do so and it keeps them from falling down . I am thinking of tacking them with a needle and thread in a couple spots to keep the X in the ties in place . I am already thinking of repurposing this costume and cutting off the ties and painting bones for a skeleton costume next year . The jumpsuit with the hood is so cool , if it was a different material I would wear this out regularly  . The cut is just so great . I totally recommend this to anyone , it's one of the most flattering " cheap" costumes I have ever bought. Oh and I am a C cup and my regular ( black ) bra works perfect and is not too revealing at all . I guess depending on the look you want , I'm sure if you wear a push-up bra it will definitely accentuate your bust , but my bra is perfect and does not show too much . I can't say enough good things about it  , so glad I found it ❤️

On the subject of the costume itself, the hood is a tad big but as you can see i managed to just put it on partially the pants are nothing special just some cheap black thin sweatpants, really like the torso on it although the cheap fake leather while somewhat convincing isn’t easily moved. The biggest issue i have with it is that the bootstraps are made of the same cheap leather material and although they look cool are 100% not going over my calfs and even if i did get them over would cause tearing. text: Got the costume today, and couldn't resist putting it on. I'm about 6'1" and around 180lbs and it fit just fine. Took a little bit of maneuvering to get into it, but plenty of room once I was inside. Your hands and feet have elastic around the wrists/ankle, and there's a fan inside which inflates it (pretty quickly) and is powered by 4 AA batteries which you have to provide. It also comes with two "claw" gloves. I was able to walk around in it easily, though because it is sealed it gets hot pretty quickly inside of it, so be prepared for that.One note on taking it off - once you unzip it or shut off the fan the air rushes out and it collapses on to you. If you're someone on the claustrophobic side make sure to prepare yourself for it since it takes a few seconds to actually get off.But so far this thing is awesome and I'm looking forward to using it on Halloween and many other occasions!
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2018

text: I found this on a list for gift ideas for either a Kindergarten or five-year old girl.It's great.  My girl likes both the dress up aspect of it and the tools.One major advantage of this over other doctor toy sets is that the thermometer "works" without being put into mouths (or, heaven forbid, other orifices).  The child can just click a button, and a new temperature shows up every time.The stethoscope is also cool in that it makes its own noises--including coughing and heart beat sounds.  Just have two AAA batteries and a very small screwdriver ready to activate it.  Batteries and screwdriver not included!Our girl is five, and about 41 pounds, and the white coat seems just a slight bit too large for her--but it fits plenty well enough for playing.  Be sure to have a Sharpie handy to write the kid's name on the name tag.The mask seems to be the weakest part of the costume set.  It is poorly designed and doesn't stay on very well.We bought our daughter about 9 or so Christmas gifts in this price range, and this was by far her favorite!

text: I really love this costume! The colors, the quirkiness, and the touch of sass make it just what I like! I was unsure about fit, but this fits me very well. It is just big enough on me that I can get it on and off without unzipping, but it doesn't look big on me. For reference my chest is 48 and my stomach is 47. text: Hey everyone, so I just tried on this costume and I have to say...It's pretty freaking awesome and here's why:Let's start with the fit. I'm 5'9 160 pounds, athletic build and I bought a size medium. When I first put on the costume I was wearing only ankle socks and some compression boxer briefs. There's two zippers on the back that meet. One starts at the lower back and the other one at the top of the back of the head. Slipping on the feet portions of the costume was a challenge, but I wear size 11's so that's pretty big for my height. After I stepped into the legs and did that I slipped into the arms and hands no problem. The real challenge was zipping up the back by myself! I have a rather large head so my biggest worry was the fit of the mask, but that fit perfectly! Seeing through the eyes isn't great but that's too be expected if you don't want your eyes to be seen. It took me about 2 minutes of fanagling to zip up the back but I go it. It's important that I tell you that the mask is attached to the costume. This may discourage you, but based on the thinness of the costume you can easily tuck the mask in the front and play the role of a Peter Parker who needs some fresh air. However this was already thought about by the designer which is why the area where your nose and mouth is is even thinner then the rest. This is done effectively without giving up appearance quality. Tucking the mask in will leave the back wide open due to the upper zipper being pulled so possibly a red compression shirt would work best for those of you who want to take the mask off frequently. Anyways, so the fit is fantastic! I feel like this costume was created just for me! It fits perfectly in all the right places. It's really a credit to Rubies. This is a quality product from what I can see.Okay, so now let's talk about appearance. Wow. This costume could not be more true to the comic book colors and design of the Spider-man we all love. It looks even better than the picture on here! One this that really bothered me about other costumes I've looked at is that the back of the costume was blank or the exact same black spider on both sides. That's just lazy. Rubie's stays true to the comics by having a large red spider on the back. If you still need another reason to buy this costume then look no further than the PRICE. I paid $33 for mine. Are you serious? What a steal. Buy this costume right now! You will not regret it! Feel free to ask me any questions. I will reply quickly being as I am always on my phone. Thank you for reading!
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2014

text: Fits great!  I read a lot of reviews before deciding on the S/M for myself, definitely do the same if you are inbetween sizes or have proportions that you know may be problematic.I am 5'9" medium athletic build and my weight tends to fluctuate around 185 +/-5 lbs.  I generally wear M/L in men's sizes, with M fitting on the tighter end, L being a bit looser.  15.5" neck 34" arm length.  34" waist, 30" inseam.  40-42R jacket and sports jersey size.  This should give you a really good idea of measurements and adjust for yourself.The S/M is almost perfect for me, the length/height is just right, however, the shoulders felt a little bit tight (I've always had wider shoulders for my build).  The waist and chest were perfect maybe a bit on the tight side but anyone lighter than 180lbs should feel very comfortable.  Taller slimmer men might be OK in this suit as well, but taller than 5'11" you may be looking at a nuthugging/highwater situation.  The M/L however would probably end up really baggy.  Overally I'm extremely pleased with how the S/M fits me, I just need to do some crunches to get that gut into shape before Halloween!As for the suit itself, the quality and detail are outstanding.  While the patch and insignias are not exactly true to the movie (the Top Gun patch isn't used, a US Navy patch is missing, and juxtaposed) it is close enough to look outstanding and convincing.  The suit itself is actually pretty high quality and stylish compared to some of the other variants out there.  Really pleased and I'm looking forward to Halloween!!!

text: I'm a grandma who purchased this set for my 3 3/4 year old grandson who is big into being a policeman and "arresting" whoever he can. This is one of the best designed and constructed costumes I have ever seen. Pockets in the front allow the child to carry the radio (sounds like a real police radio w/static!), whistle, handcuffs, etc. The hat has a badge that can be worn on the hat or attached to the chest pocket. There is even an identification card that can be completed and a photo attached. Also comes with a "ticket" which I made copies of so he could hand these out.Alex is big for his age and I would guess that the costume is a size 5.  Perfect for him now to wear over a shirt or sweater. under. He can easily wear it into next year. This costume is way more than expected for the price. So good, in fact, that I'm going to order the physician costume for Alex!

text: I like writing detailed & thorough reviews so I expect this to be long. (You've been warned.) I, personally, scroll all over for super close comparison sizes from previous reviewers. If you do that too, I hope this can help.I first searched for a Halloween party type costume on here for my October birthday. I consider myself an average-to-short young adult woman, on the bigger torso side, with no curves or any thickness in any of the right places, and I have no junk in the trunk at all. I'm 5'5", approx. 160-165 lbs, 36D, wear medium t-shirts, U.S. 13-14 in jeans, and prefer a *little* bit of tight clothing. I ordered a large and I'm super happy. Here's why.To start off, I'm obsessed with astronomy so seeing this pop up on my search was a no-brainer. It was delivered within 2 days, it's comfortable, the silver material is stretchy, & you can pick & choose what accessories to wear with it. I personally chose not to wear the clear plastic hoodie (attaches via velcro) nor the leg garter... yet. (Haven't tried it on yet, I think the costume looks fine without, but I will try it on again later.) I paired it with black yoga pants underneath for warmth, modesty for the rump, & at the recommendation of previous reviewers. (I'm wearing the leggings AND butt pads also from Amazon too, and this costume STILL is big in the back side. Not hugely though, it doesn't get in the way or expose your whole cheek or anything. If you have a butt, then you'll be fine. But my pancake flap jacks couldn't fill it. All good.) I love the zipper in the front so you can decide how much or how little of the ladies you wanna show off.  The shoulder pad part has a material that is thick/unforgiving, & makes it a little difficult to get over broad football player shoulders like mine. All I did was a little shimmy and it fit right over. Problem solved then fit like a glove. Other than that, it's very breathable, very comfortable, very cute, & I can't wait to wear it for my party. Like most one-piece costumes, it doesn't accommodate differences in shoulder widths, bust/waist measurements, or back side size/shapes. But the large fits me 99% well in 99% of the places, so I consider this a win. I didn't look at nor follow the size guide, so I can't comment whether it's accurate or not. I just followed all the review suggestions, my gut feeling, & my previous experiences in online shopping for Halloween costumes. Now, if I have to make a mad dash to the bathroom, this costume could prove difficult to remove in short time frame. Guess I'll just have to pay attention & give myself plenty of time.I can't find any major cons of this costume. My shoulders are big and my back side is small, so what? The costume isn't ripping nor falling apart. & it's super cute.Do yourself a favor & BUY THIS COSTUME! I absolutely love it & see myself wearing it for a few years. I hope this review made sense...
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2020
title: Do yourself a favor & BUY THIS COSTUME!
product name: Leg Avenue Women's Galaxy Girl Astronaut Halloween Costume

text: I ended up returning this because it was really small and it isn't really made for adult hands and feet. I really really wanted this costume to work for Halloween (2015) but alas it just fit awkwardly..I am 5'10 150 lbs and the medium was tight on me. I couldn't really fully zip up the back without worrying that I would tear it apart.The hands, as someone else had mentioned, had finger space of about two inches before the webbing started to go to the next finger...I don't know about you, but children are the only people I know with two inch fingers.The feet were really small. I don't have big feet for a guy...wear a men's size 9 and my feet are narrow, but I couldn't even squeeze my feet into them, once again, they felt like they were made for children.The packaging says recommended height of 5'3"I would avoid buying this unless you buy a size or two bigger, but even then you're going to have weird looking baby hands. The costume itself looked decent, the fit was just all wrong and not made for Americans.Review Disclaimer: I did not receive this product discounted nor was I asked to review it by the seller. I am merely posting this review in hopes to aid others in their decision making process and what size to get.

text: Of course, I hopped onto the bandwagon and got this to surprise my kids on their first day of school. We had fun with it.This costume inflates with a build-in fan that runs on AA batteries, which is fantastic since I was dreading having to blow this thing up myself. It inflates within a minute or two after you get into it and turn it on.It's a bit awkward to get into, but if you put it on like a pair of pants (without shoes first, as there's not a lot of clearance for the foot holes), get your arms into the arm holes and then flop the whole thing over your head, zip it up, then turn on the fan, it's not too bad. Takes me a few minutes to be ready to be the king of dinosaurs and become unable to enjoy a game of Patty Cake.You will SWEAT like crazy in this suit. There's ZERO ventilation outside from that small hand-sized fan that brings in air to keep it inflated. When I used it to pick up my kids from school, I was drenched with sweat just being in an athletic shirt and shorts... but then again, it was 90 degrees with high humidity that day. If you want to go trick or treating on Halloween, I'd feel safe wearing very little with this on.There is a little viewing window and you can see pretty clearly what's going on... but just in front of you. There's no peripheral vision at all.I am 5'7" with a thin, somewhat athletic build and the adult-sized costume fit me pretty well.The suit itself seems cheap and "Made in China" flimsy, so I had my doubts... but it hasn't busted a hole yet, and the tail drags on concrete, asphalt... everything. I haven't done any skydives without a parachute to test its durability, but for less than $50, it's already worth the gag I wanted it for.UPDATE 20180926: Not happy. The fan already busted. I've used this ONCE. Go figure that you can get replacement fans for $15... but still, only one use isn't very good. I took a look and noticed why it died: poor soldering, which allowed for one of the wires to lose contact with the fan motor (see photo). After re-soldering the contact points, it started working again, so that's good... but having to fix this in the first place is kind of a downer for something that relatively costs so much.
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2018
title: This thing is epic... when it works. Fan died after one use =(

text: I have a son who just turned 3 in January and I'd wanted to start promoting his love of make-believe with some hats for dress up. Of course he has a firefighter one already and I thought an engineer cap would suit him perfectly, what with our huge Melissa & Doug train set and his adoration of Thomas since he was old enough to point to a train! When reviewing my options, I came across this role play set and decided it'd be worth the investment because it came with so many items that we could use in a variety of ways. The hat and apron are sturdy and adorable. The train schedule is part of what makes it a bit more educational, though I believe the educational level of any toy is what you make of it when playing and teaching your child. These things alone would have been enough, but the set comes with bonus items: a walkie talkie, hammer and wrench, all of which go in my son's tool box now. So they can be used for playing more than just trains. Very pleased with this purchase.

text: I got this coatume as a birthday gift for my friend who is a huge attention monger. Of course he went nuts for it and immediate started wearing it everywhere.  He loves it.  Too much.  He wants to wear it all the time and everywhere and if constantly harassing me to try to come up with new and attention grabbing things he can do in the costume.  He had been skateboarding, bowling, rode a mechanical bull, ice skating, etc.  the costume is pretty durable. But highly annoying to ME.  Here are the pros: decent battery life.  He's been in it for a constant 9 hrs with no loss of battery.  Warm which is nice for cool climates.  Children LOVE it.  So do adults.  Not easy to rip or tear.Cons: you will be stopped for photos every fewMinutes.  Not asked for them, but literally yelled at, grabbed and harassed for photos by ADULTS WANTING SELFIES.  No one will respectYour group or the fact that you are having a social night out with your friends.  You are dealing with entitled adults who believe their wants and needs supersede anyone else's.  Their picture is worth more than your boundaries.  YOU WILL BE ASSAULTED.  This is based on the testimony of 4 people I know with this costume.  You will be hit, punched, smacked with sticks or objects, purposely have your tail stepped on, you will be squeezed to remove your air, and you will be grabbed.  A lot. This is fair warning.Other than that, it's cute.  It's fun.  Kids love love love it.  Adults can be a bit unruly.

text: I ordered this for my 3.5 year old to wear for Halloween.  He is very small for his age and the vest was far too big for him but he insisted on wearing it anyway! I was pleased that the vest is very well constructed and not like most costumes that fall apart easily.  The hard hat is adjustable, and the hammer and saw that came with this are well-made enough that he (AND his 1.5 year old brother) will have a lot of fun playing "construction worker" for quite a while.UPDATE 04/03/13:  This costume is still going strong and is a favorite of my now 5 and almost 4 year olds!  The seams are holding up and the accessories are still in good shape.  The elastic on the goggles is stretched but that from the skirmishes between the boys over it!  Well worth the money spent!UPDATE 10/30/15: Yes, we still have the costume and it's still a favorite play item for my now 8 and 6 year olds, along with their 6 year old cousin.  It's useful life will be coming to an end soon since the children are growing but the costume has, with the exception of some fading/abrading of the reflective striping (a definite plus when trick-or-treating), survived a 5-year stint of "work" and play. Great product, great price!
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2010

text: In my past cosplay experience, it's usually true that you get what you pay for; but this is not the case with this Spidey suit!! Got it for the Spiderman Homecoming premier and I really do feel like the bug boy himself when I put it on!I am 5'11, and the medium fits fine but if I had even another two inches I would recommend the next size up. I have it stretched to the limit, but that's just because I prefer to wear it tight (being disproportionately skinny for my height). I've got a 28" midriff and 45" shoulders, and the medium fit great in both places. The crotch comes a little low (leg shafts a bit too short), but I can't blame anyone for that because I have freakishly long legs for a human being. If you too have an absurdly lengthy lower torso, you should be able to pin thr crotch up a little bit so that you don't have quite as much of a  web in your thigh gap. Plus that helps to show off the hot cross buns 🔥

text: This was the best Halloween costume ever!! We bought it for my 10 year old son who is about 4’10” and it was slightly big on him, but the kids version sounded way too small. It feels hot inside for a minute but the fan is super helpful. Because my son is a little small we had trouble keeping his face in the window but he managed, and it is an adult costume so totally not unreasonable. He LOVED his costume and says he wants to wear it next year as well, and even wanted to make sure I sent photos to his teacher because he was so proud. It held up surprisingly well as you could hear parts dragging on the sidewalk while we were walking around but it never got a hole or anything which is awesome! My older daughter was not trick-or-treating but still went up to the door with him to hold his tail because he kept knocking things over! The sound plays a few times also, but it was a pain getting to the battery pack! I would definitely purchase again. Maybe next year we will be a family of dinosaurs!

text: My wife and I ordered this Mario costume (size Small 4-6) for our 5-year-old little boy and overall we like the costume but are disappointed by how cheaply made the product is. If your child is particularly rambunctious or rough on clothing this costume is almost guaranteed to tear due to the absolute bottom-tier materials.This Mario costume consists of the distinctive blue coveralls and red shirt which is really just one large jumpsuit with an opening at the back to slide the entire costume on. The back is secured by Velcro strips. Also included with this costume are the red 'M' Mario hat and mustache. Oddly, the distinctive white gloves are missing. We ordered my younger son the matching Luigi costume from the same brand and it comes with the gloves but no mustache, which again, is just a bit strange.The materials used in each of the components is 100% Polyester. My son loved his costume but as a parent, I dislike the cheap materials which really do a disservice to the Nintendo brand. The costume also runs incredibly hot. On a chilly Halloween night, both my sons were drenched with sweat from running around with these costumes on. Word of warning if you live in warmer climates.This product speaks to our throw-away culture and is really not built to last more than a single season. My son is a fan and the costume is cute and definitely fits the Mario character. However, carefully consider how your child will use the costume before ordering. If you're expecting a long life or repeated use this is not the costume to order.
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2018
title: Hey, It's-a Me, Mario!
product name: Nintendo Super Mario Bros DISK73689L Classic Costume, (Small 4-6 years)

text: pretty disappointed with the helmet on this. I decided to go with Melissa & Doug brand because I bought so many different dress up costumes over the years for little ones in my family and now that I have my own little ones  I wanted good quality for them as well. I tried to look closely at co.parable brands helmets because this was the main purpose for me for my little guys as I wanted something to be quality that will hold up over the years and stay on their head without a  strap to go around their chin. We have the firefighter helmet and that band on the inside is MUCH more functional than this. Somewhat of a pain to adjust but at least it stays the way you set it!This immediately comes apart. It has 2 separate snap pieces on it and neither stay together. I had to tape them both.  And then the little plastic post pieces have to turn weirdly upward to attach to the helmet a d it stays for a few minutes but it comes right apart when its taken off of a kids head  😑 i may try to tape that together as well instead of returning it but I shouldn't have to do that.I dont ubderstand why they would slack on this set when the firefighter helmet stays together no problem and is durable.The helmet part itself is however a good, firm plactic... but again... pointless if it can't stay on their head.I had contemplated also with trying a different brand before ordering this because it offered a few more tools with it which would have been fun also.  But Knowing the typical quality of Melissa and Doug I decided on this.Ill be ordering the other brand for my other little quy now to compare the two because Im so bummed about this Helmet.
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2020
title: Terrible helmet band

text: This costume was a huge success & made my son so happy.  He got a ton of attention at his Halloween party & the costume held up ok under his natural abuse.  It lost a star because of a few negatives, that only mattered a little to my son.  One was that the zipper came out of one side of the zipper fob right as he was about to go Trick or Treating in it.  I'm sure he pulled it too hard, but it was a little flimsy.  I was able to fix it and jam the zipper back together, and then tape the slight opening where the zipper was separated, but it's a critical component to hold the air in & he won't be able to wear it again because of this.  The other was that it's too hot and awkward for long walks, which should be expected because of what it is, so if this is a problem for you, you should consider that factor.  If he had listened to me about wearing something different to trick-or-treat in, then it wouldn't have been a problem for him.  Overall the costume performed as expected, was a decent quality (with the exception of the zipper problem), and it was definitely a favorite costume with his peers.

text: Super late review,  but better late than never. I bought this costume for a Halloween party. It was part of a couple costume,  my husband being Marc Antony.  I was looking for something sexy but not too revealing.  This definitely fit the bill. I loved the body stocking except for no hole to pee! That definitely posed a problem while drinking.  It was also pretty warm while dancing, but then again I live in SoCal so it could be that too. By the end of the night I had taken off the stocking and left the overdress on . As a large busted woman, I was worried about the boob situation.  Ladies, if you are large chested invest in some boob tape otherwise you will see ANY type of bra you put on. Believe me,  I tried my whole arsenal. Those slits by the way, wow. They started at my waist! I will admit that it flared gorgeously while I walked. When I wasn't almost tripping on the extra length. Lol High heels would have worked better but I used flat sandals. For reference  I am a 5 foot 7 inch, 200 lb hourglass shaped woman.

text: Hello,I am not sure if I'm on the right forum or not but..here goes:My name is Bernie, I'm a single Tyrannosaurus Rex of the Theropod family originally from Laramidia or what you might know as the Western U.S. region. My parents were Malcolm and Tricia Bones originally from Gondwana (I'm first generation) who were both professional dancers however my father was banished from Gondwana after accidentally squishing the High Order King's daughter Linda during a Carnivore's Ball when he was 29. Well...anyway I still live pretty close to them and we raid a farm or city bus every other week for a meal and to catch up.Currently I'm working at a small seasonal theme park that operates spring through fall. My job is to scare customers without harming or eating them and occasionally do some landscaping however with my short arms I find it really hard to do anything involving any general lifting or pulling movements. In the winters I dress up as a reindeer at Malls but am required to stay perfectly still. My boss used to send me to schools but I'm not allowed within 50 feet after the last "running incident" where I ate about a dozen school children after I sneezed and they realized I was real....It isn't my fault it is in my blood to chase...Anyway I love cats, large mammal bones, going for a jog in the park, and I'm very in to history particularly Late Cretaceous periods discussing the Cretaceous-Paleogene mass extinction and theories involved....I"m a nice enough guy honestly I'm just looking for a she-Rex that is pretty, likes humble guys, and enjoys a quiet evening in a cave gnawing on bones watching re--runs of the TV series Dinosaurs...Man was that show great!Please call me, don't text I really can't use my fingers or even pick up my phone most of the time....

text: Sure wish I had seen this before buying the playschool Dr. set for my 3-4 year old grandson.  Just like their Policeman costume (AMAZING quality and accessories), the Dr. set is way above average in construction and instruments. The stethoscope even gives coughing sounds. I does not give a heartbeat but none of the play sets do and at least this one makes noise.  4 great pockets to store the  "instruments" in AND a mask, which Alex loves most of all. The mask has Velcro so it fits any head by hooking over the ears. There is a place to write the child's name in on a card in the front pocket and a large, realistic medical emblem on the back. Like all of their costumes, the Dr. outfit comes on a hanger with heavy plastic over it. That way, after playing, the instruments go into the 4 pockets, the stethoscope over the hanger, the lab coat on the hanger and then cover it all up to hang neatly in the closet. Sure beats having all those items all over the house!  Melissa and Doug outfits really are worth way more than the  price they charge to get all of their extras. I'm careful with my money but I really believe these costumes are the best this grandma, or anyone can buy.
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2014
title: The only Dr. costume you'll need to buy.
product name: Melissa & Doug Doctor Role Play Costume Set

text: Bought this for Halloween. More than I would have liked to pay for a costume but my son had his heart set on it. He is 5’4” and it was perfect for him. He could look out the lower viewing window. Seems decently durable. Made it though a couple hours of walking around and in and out of vehicle during Halloween. I am 5’7” and when I tried it on it fit fine. I was able to look through the upper panel.It was easy to use and figure out. It got tons of looks and my son had a blast.A few things I think they could improve on - a little more powerful fan. While yes it worked fine. It took a minute to re-inflate if he had to bend over for something.Only other issue was that there is a black mesh behind the plastic viewing pane- which helps hide your face. Only issue we ran into was that it was cold outside (approx 40 degrees) and it would fog up that viewing panel - since it had the black mesh on the inside it was kind of hard to wipe off. I would put my hand on the outside and my son would use his hair/head and push against my hand and wipe back and forth to wipe it off some. Also, once it was darker out he wasn’t able to see crap lol. While I must admit it was hilarious when he tripped and fell - (luckily he was fine).  But that it one downside. Can’t see your feet and hard to see when it’s darker outside.Overall I would definitely recommend this because we had some good belly laughs with it and my son had a riot.

text: Absolutely adorable bat costume or warm Halloween themed-bat jacket! I wore this for Halloween to a friend’s party and was the only one not cold outside and I got tons of compliments! If anything I was too hot inside the house, but it was just as cute unzipped With a cute tunic top and leggings and I brought a spare set of ears in case I had to take it off. I bought both a medium and a large because sometimes I’m in between sizes. They both fit but the large fit better in length and space to wear an outfit under while still showing my curves. The shorter length of the medium looked funny on me because the center point on the bottom front hemline hit at my crotch area in a funny place. I found it to be distracting. I ended up giving the medium size to my sister who is 5’2” and it looked better on her. For reference I am 5’4”, 36DDD, hourglass shaped. I usually order a large in this kind of apparel because of my bust and I like things to fit a little on the loose side, but still fitted, rather than tight to the body.

text: Laughter guaranteed!  I am a very petite female (5'2, 95 lbs) so I expected this to be somewhat large. I've ordered another morph costume from this brand before, and with both suits, I have had to bobby pin the head closer to the waistband to prevent drooping. Unlike the other morph costume, this one requires you to use your own stuffing. I used crumpled up newspaper and it worked just fine, however, prepare for lots of paper crunching noise when walking around!In my opinion, one disappointing flaw was the way that the oompa loompa's "hair" is attached to the plush head. No matter what I did, the hair would fall towards the front, completely covering the character's face.Despite how funny this costume is, I am giving this three stars because the quality is significantly lower than the other morph costume made by the same brand. I've included a picture for reference: I am Willy Wonka riding an oompa loompa, and my cat was my Wonka bar!

text: We got the fireman set last year for Halloween for my older son (and the younger one went as a fire dog. It was really cute!), and we have used it again and again. They found a piece of plastic tubing in our shed a while back and that has become the hose. When kids come over to play, they go for the fireman outfit and the M&D construction vest and set again and again.  These costumes are totally worth the price, especially when they're on sale, because they hold up to rough play and the pulling on and off of little hands.  We bought the Knight costume this year for my older son, and I expect we'll have great fun with it long after the boom and bust of Halloween.  With all that said, the bull horn does break very easily as other reviewers have noted, and it did for us, too.  My boys still play with it and with the whole set, and honestly, I would rather they make their own pretend noises than listen to the battery operated ones, so I would say that maybe the broken bullhorn ends up being a win-win.

text: My nephew is obsessed with trains. I bought this as a gift for his 7th birthday. I was a bit worried about sizing, since one reviewer bought it for their 3 year old and the manufacturer lists the ages as 3-6. I decided to take a chance and I'm glad I did. It fit him perfectly! The minute he unwrapped this, his eyes lit up and he begged to put it on. He has barely taken it off since! It was a huge hit. It also fits his younger brother, who is a small-for-his-age 5 year old, so it really can work for a variety of ages.The quality of this costume is excellent. It doesn't feel cheap or chintzy like some children's costumes I have seen. The material is thick and stitched strongly. The buttons on the shoulder straps are tightly sewn, so they won't pop off easily. It isn't the type of costume that is going to fall apart in one wash. This is something that will last in the dress up trunk for years. I definitely plan to buy more costumes in the Melissa & Doug line!

text: This is so worth the money. It’s good for dress up or a fancy Halloween. We have some name brand dresses from a famous mouse company that shall not be name, and this dress is as good if not better made then those dresses. The glitter is really on there. The material is soft for synthetic material (doesn’t feel like plastic). There is a light petticoat to poof out the dress some but if you want it super poofy get a petticoat. I personally think it’s perfect as is though. It is a more traditional pink dress so not hot pink, think cotton candy or bubblegum. There is a lining for the skirt part of the dress to keep it from being scratchy with the under petticoat which is a muslin/cotton like material. There is this soft mesh material for the sleeves and it carries up to the neck. It is perfect for those tiny shoulders of your toddler or kiddo. I will be buying more from this company,  Relibeauty. Love love love this princess dress

text: The costume arrived on time and in good condition and looked exactly like the picture. I wore a long sleeve black t-shirt and black leggings under it, and used the leg warmers on my arms, as they were too small to wear on my legs. (I bought some yellow ribbon to pin around my leggings to create stripes on my legs.) At a Halloween party at work, it was voted the best costume. When I wore it to hand out candy on Halloween night,  little kids were thrilled ("Mom, a bumblebee gave me candy!") and their parents laughed. I'm 5'2" and it was plenty roomy and comfortable, even when sitting in a chair at my office. Surprisingly, even though it's large it made me look slimmer, which is great!  A couple of friends borrowed the costume for parties - one is about 5 feet tall and probably 180 pounds; the other is about 5'7" and a bit over 200 pounds, and it fit both of them fine.  Definitely a good buy. (Also - It easily packs up in a small box, and doesn't take up much room in the closet, which is nice.)

title: Great costume

text: Me: Hey hun, me and your son are going to be Goldilocks and baby bear for Halloween! You should get a costume that matched the theme! (Thinking he would go as a bear, a bowl of porridge or a rocking chair)Him: Say no more ! I have the perfect costume.- Amazon package arrives two days later and I open it before he comes home...Me (thinking to myself)- Ahh yes , Goldilocks baby bear and the German Pimp. A childhood classic.** While I’m not thrilled with him I will say this costume is absolutely perfect, came in great condition, sized accurately in my opinion (I am a five foot tall woman though but I had a blast modeling the costume to send him preview pictures lol) . It also fits my six foot tall husband. He wears XL-2XL and it fits him perfectly. The hat really adds a certain sense of perfection to the costume especially the red feather. text: Melissa & Doug do it again!  My son adores all types of cars and loves to pretend that he is a race car driver.  This set takes his play over the top!  The outfit seems to be very sturdy and can stand up to the washing machine and come out looking great.  The patches are secure, this certainly isn't some poor quality costume.  I wish I would have ordered it sooner, it would have been a wonderful Halloween costume.  I can't say much about the steering wheel, for whatever reason it just doesn't appeal to him.  He far prefers to just drive around his little cars.  However, the next large box I get I think he would get a big kick out of sitting in it and pretending to "drive".  Don't hesitate to order this great set!  There is elastic at the cuffs so right now it is a little large on him but it doesn't bother him because the elastic still makes it feel like it fits.  However there is a lot of room to grow into it.

text: I haven't dressed up since I was a child, but I've always wanted to. Time would just slip away from me or I couldn't decide on what to do. Last year was different. I found this on Amazon and fell in love with it. I've been working out a lot and have lost a good deal of weight, and wanted to really show that off. This costume is a really great mix of like a more modest sexy, if that makes sense. I was almost completely covered from head to toe, but was told over and over how beautiful and sexy I looked.I really felt so empowered in this costume!I'm 5,3" 170lbs and 34DDD. Ordered a size large. The mini dress beneath the coat is extremely form fitting, but it is very stretchy! And the coat was snug in all the right places without hindering movement. My only complaints were that the coat, collar, and belt are secured by velcro and it's not the strongest velcro in the world. I sewed some buttons in to feel more confident nothing would pop open or off since I was going to be out partying with friends.

I had originally bought the accessories at a costume store, and very glad I did since they are sold out now. The wig I got was $20 and 100 times better from the exact same brand. This package costume is worth $19.99 at most.  It is too late for me to return at this point and get a new dress, the costume store has one for $50, but it isn't shaped right. If you are going for easy and on the cheap, this would work, but if you want to look good right out of the package, this is not the buy for you.

text: After reading many of the reviews on this costume I decided to go with the medium/large size. As with many others when putting this on, it does fit a bit tight in the crotch, but this can be fixed a bit once fully on by pulling down on the suit a bit. I'm 5' 11" 205lbs and with a 44" chest, 32" inseam and 36" waist. To me, it fit pretty darn perfect, though you may need a hand in getting out of it, as it is a bit snug and form fitting! I can tell you that the women at our Halloween party really loved the effect. You can't pull this costume off with a beer gut, so spare yourself  and go another route. Costume is fairly well made as others have also noted. I took off a star as others have pointed out that this were NO aviator sun glasses included with costume. Apparently this costume once included a pair, but alas no longer! Online wording saying 2 Piece needs to be changed, as it's only one piece, just the suit itself is in the package. Included are two velcro attached separate name patches. One for Maverick and the other for Goose. Honestly, I don't know who the heck would want to be the guy who ends up dead from a broken neck. The other name tag should be for Iceman. I ended up making my own Iceman name tag from the Goose one which I would never have used anyway. I blacked out the red lettering and then stick-on letters I bought at a hobby shop. It came out great. All other patches are well sewn on. Not certain what costume others are talking about saying they weren't properly attached as mine couldn't have been put on any better. Price on Amazon is much better than you'd pay at Party City as well.
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2014
title: Top Flight Costume
product name: Leg Avenue Men's Top Gun Flight Suit Costume

text: The concept of this costume is great, but the designer really cut corners in the design and materials that were used. The material is thin and more shear than is decent. The back of the dress is a solid color instead of keeping it consistent with the front of the dress. Though I understand why they put in the high neck (so you wouldn't have to do the neck make-up), it makes the look of the dress seem off. The gloves were fine. The wig was terrible!! There was barely enough yarn on it to cover the head bag it was attached to. I would have had to go out and buy more yarn and sew it on myself to get a proper look. When I buy costumes all I want to do is add accessories- not buy more materials to improve the product I paid for. I would recommend making your own Sally costume if you want something decent. The Standard and the Sassy Sally are worth the money.

text: We went to Party City fully expecting to spend $40 on a costume - when we went we disliked all of the ones we looked at (we couldn't try on in store due to COVID). We decided to try Amazon instead and found this cute "black dragon" costume for the same price. This costume has exceeded our expectations. It's soft and velvety feeling! It zips up (instead of the buttons or velcro most costumes come with) and is pretty thick which will be great for our unpredictable Northwest Indiana weather! My son is in the 90% percentile for his age and at 1 year old is usually wearing 2T. We ordered the 12-18 month and it fits him great besides the arms are a little short but I chalk that up to my son being pretty huge for his age 😂 most long sleeves fit him this way. We are going to get a (hopefully long enough) black long sleeve shirt and/or hoodie to put under this along with black gloves if needed! The booties are awesome as well! We can fit his shoes inside!

text: Seriously, everybody needs one of these in their life. I bought one for my friend for her birthday (she's short and we call her a baby trex, it seemed fitting) , then decided I Needed one. Its the best $50 ive ever spent on something. We also have incorporated this into a team building event for work. I live near water so the mosquitos are insane this year. the only way i can water my plants or mow is with this costume on. The people walking on the path get a real kick out of it. I have worn this to stores when Covid was first a thing. Also a good time. I have rollerbladed as t rex, I have wrapped presents as t rex, and i go shopping as a t rex. I love this thing. I will admit, its  a little hard to see, and it gets hot in there, but i bought a usb mini fan that i plug into my cell phone and stick it in the suit with me. Tons of fun. My boyfriend is actually annoyed with me, because i sneak it into the car and randomly change into it as often as i can.  Don't think about it. You need one of these!

text: I can't wait to wear this! I was a little concerned when I ordered it, because as you probably know, most Halloween costumes are made so cheap that you can see straight through them...especially the tight fitting ones. However, I was pleasantly surprised to find that the material on this costume is not see through at all. It's actually quite thick. I tried it on and it fits perfectly, looking super cute and sexy without having to show a ton of skin. I ordered the medium (I'm 5'8" and 145 lbs).  Even though it is a one piece, it fits my legs and long torso without any awkward creepage lol. Only thing is the red ties for the legs and arms don't stay in place. One end of each of the ties is already sewn on to the material, but then when you wrap it, the ties slide down. I will have to permanently sew the ties where I want them to stay. I still need to find some cute knee high boots to go with it...and it's definitely going to require a U-Plunge Bra.

text: Bought this for my son for Halloween 2012. He was 3yrs old and 35 inches tall at the time. It coat is well made, it's waterproof and is roomy enough to wear layers of clothes underneath. The sleeves were a little long for him at the time. The hat was cute but the plastic inside kept popping out of the holes. The plastic badge was a little fragile and cracked after about a week. The ID card is cute and fits into the front pocket. The bullhorn is one of his favorite things... it has sounds that are not too loud. My only suggestion would be to add velcro on the fire extinguisher and bullhorn so they stick to the coat. There are rings on the coat to hang them on, but they fall off easily.  We hung a flashlight on one of the rings instead. Now my son is 4 yrs old, 40 inches and 34 lbs and the suit fits perfectly. He wore it with fireman boots from Target and got lots of compliments. He plans to wear it again this Halloween. Overall a good buy and worth the price!

text: Taking our girl to the bibbity bobbity boutique next week and wanted to save a little money by bringing our own dress. This dress is better quality and a fraction of the price than the Disney store gowns. My 7 year old is a size 8, and this fits great. The length is probably above the ankle on her, but she’s a on the taller side of her age group. She’s also thin, and this dress gives a little more room in the body, so it’s not exactly form fitting on her, but that’s great in my opinion and will let her wear it longer. If you’re buying it for play - it’s great quality and should last a long time! If you’re buying it for a party or for Disney like us, I would definitely use a steamer and get rid of all of those wrinkles from being shipped. It makes a world of difference! Especially if photos will be involved!

text: I would say this costume is the opposite of comfortable. I would classify this costume as dangerous.I purchased two of these costumes for my wife and I to wear, to surprise my 3 year old on his birthday. We also purchased a non-inflatable costume for him so we could all wear matching costumes and dance to his favorite songs on his birthday. Sounds like a fun time right?It was great for about 3 minutes. As the miniature fan blows air into the costume the dinosaurs head will rise until you can see through a plastic panel placed at the dinosaur's neck.The problem is the plastic panel is poorly constructed and has sharp plastic corners on each side. So as you walk in an inflatable costume, the head will bob because it's an inflatable costume so the plastic edges are wobbling around near your eyes. As a result the plastic scratched my eye and ruined my night. Luckily I wasn't bleeding. My neighbor is a Phycisians assistant. He told me the eye heals quickly and that i should be okay the next day. He was right. But I would not recommend this product to anyone. If the damage to my eye was more severe, I would likely have sued the company.Fair warning.P.s. amazon removed my first review despite the fact that this review complies with their guidelines. If they do not accept this review I will escalate the complaint and if that fails I will cancel my account.
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2020
title: Eye injury due to poor craftsmanship
product name: Rubie's Adult Official Jurassic World Inflatable Dinosaur Costume

text: My son is almost 5 years old and he loves bats. I know this costume seems very feminine but it really is only the top part that you get, which is very cute, warm and best of all not sexy. I wouldn't dress my son OR daughter the way this little girl is dressed. If you omit the make up, fish net stockings and colored hair piece this is an adorable costume for any gender. My son will wear this with black pants and shoes.Anyway, the costume is well made and cozy. It fits tight around the arms so you'll want to use a tight fitting undershirt. I got a size medium because I wanted to be able to reuse the costume for as many seasons as possible. My son is almost 5 and of average height (by American standards) and this costume fits perfectly. I was hoping it would be too big. It is a bit long which is to be expected because I ordered a medium but the arms are just right and next year the arms will be short and the torso will be just right I'm guessing. It'll work fine for us, but I was surprised nonetheless.

text: My 3 year old son is obsessed with anything having to do with trains. On his birthday he wore this costume so he could be a Jr. Engineer :) The accompanying tools, radio and train schedule gave him hours of play time. The only drawback is the "radio" is SUPER LOUD! There is no volume, and the train whistle recording on it startled my son several times. The buttons were also hard for him to depress. The quality of construction of the costume surpassed my expectations. The pockets are sewn well even though they are a thick see-through plastic. The fabric is a heavier durable, washable, and soft material. The sides are kept together with velcro...I would have liked to see an adjustable slip tie in the back for my skinnier guy. Overall an excellent, non-cartoon specific train related outfit to encourage role play for my son.

text: I absolutely pick my Halloween costumes based on how warm they can keep me and my and my frozen toes are in love with this giant bat hoodie! The fabric is like a blanket, the hood is INTENSELY CUTE, and the wing/arms are so much fun! This thing definitely runs small, though. I'm 5"5' and a 34B and I usually wear small/medium, but ordered a large for this based on reviews. It only just zips up on me! I'd have probably have been comfy in an XL as well! Fortunately, I won't be needing to layer for warmth wearing this delightful thing. The only downside I've noticed? The foam bits making up the claws and ears do take a couple days to dry (it's wet here in autumn; this happens). The blanket-like fabric also doesn't breathe very well, so if you're in a warmer spot you will definitely start sweating. On the other hand, I slept in this just fine the other night so if you're also that person who is cold all the time and has six blankets in the winter, I bet you'll like this as much as I do!

text: Jurassic Park is mine and my husbands' favorite movie series to watch together, so when I came across the various First Look prank ideas for the wedding day, the dino suit was instantly my favorite! I bought the dino suit, knowing it would inflate over the wedding dress so as to not touch my hair, makeup, or dress and mess anything up. As you can see in the picture, the suit had the reaction I had hoped for!The suit itself takes about 10 minutes to fully inflate (though I recommend turning the pump on a little bit before you want to put it on so you don't have to fight the material to get it on properly). There are footy holes in the dino feet so your feet can go all the way through, with tight elastic around your ankles to hold the air inside (so you can put your shoes on AFTER you get the dino suit on, thank goodness). The sound box is in the palm of the right hand so all you have to do is squeeze and you are making ferocious velociraptor sounds (it wasn't as loud as I had hoped it would be, but you could still hear it)!The head is kept upright with an elastic headpiece that fastens almost like a helmet around your head. But once it's fully inflated, the head pretty much stays upright by itself and the headpiece is mainly for keeping your face properly positioned in the window so you can see the things you almost run into right before you run into them anyways because you're not used to having a tail.The reason I'm giving the velociraptor identity suit 3 stars instead of 5 is because right as I got out of the golf cart (I was hunched over, not quite sitting but not quite standing), the zipper busted, letting out most of my air and refusing to get back on the track. My dad then held it closed to blow up enough to finish the first look, but that's why in the picture the head looks like it's about to fall. Because it was.It was a great idea and I've seen people use these all the time with much better luck than I, apparently, but I was a little disappointed that it broke on me, especially on the wedding day and not the time I tried it on to make sure it worked properly where I could have fixed it!Oh, and don't plan on being inside it for very long. It's a sauna in there. Pretty sure I lost 5 pounds in sweat in the 15 minutes I was in it, which is good for your wedding day I guess.
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2019
title: Used for my wedding First Look!
product name: Rubie's Adult Official Jurassic World Inflatable Dinosaur Costume

text: While deciding what type of costume to get for our 3 year old, we came across this Melissa and Doug Construction and thought it would be a great idea. Leading up to Halloween he has really enjoyed watching the Blippi Halloween song, which features that personality narrating while in a construction themed costume.This construction style costume is made fairly well and, overall, should last at least a couple of years, even with the occasional use during playtime. The reflective strips work great and are clearly visible when light reflects off of them. We were able to put the vest over his winter coat, had him wear his beanie with his hood going over the helmet, for a complete “construction worker in the winter time” look.As good as this costume is, there are some things that could be better and might turn those with really little ones off from buying this until they’re a little older. The goggles have no air, or breathing, holes, so after only a few minutes of wear they will fog up. We drilled holes into ours to prevent this from happening. The inner headband is not directly attached to the helmet and can come off without much effort. The connectors on the headband do not have very large points to keep the band from coming apart. The pockets aren't quite long enough to properly keep the tools from falling out, if the child moves quick enough, but the large pocket is able to fully hold the goggles.This Melissa and Doug costume is definitely a quick and convenient way to turn your child into a construction worker. If possible, we would’ve given this 3.8 stars.If you found this review "Helpful", please click the button below.
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2018
title: Fun & practical costume for your little construction worker...
product name: Melissa & Doug Construction Worker Role-Play Costume Set

text: as a point of reference, i served in the navy and wore a flight suit every days for several years, so i know how these things are supposed to be made.  that said, i'm really impressed with the quality of this costume.  the material is a good, medium weight poly with excellent stitching. i have washed the costume and it held together fine...none of the seams came apart. all of the zippers are of good heavy quality and they actually work.  lots of pockets for carrying stuff around if needed.  all the patches look great and really make this flight suit stand out from others -- there were 3 mavericks (including me) at the halloween party i attended this year but none of their flightsuits looked as authentic as mine.on the sizing: i'm 6'1" and 205 lbs...the XL was slightly large, especially in length -- if your inseam is less than 34" then you should probably go with a large or be prepared to roll up the legs...which really won't work since the legs have the zippers at the bottom to widen the legs to allow you to pull the suit on over shoes/boots.
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2016
title: from a navy vet:  VERY impressed with the quality of this flight suit!

text: So I bought three of these because when you're in lockdown, why the heck not?  Seriously, convincing my two kids (10 and 12) to join me in inflatable dinosaur costumes took a bit of effort. "Mom, it's not even CLOSE to Halloween yet!"  However, once they were in the suits, they completely embraced their inner T-Rexes!These are so easy to put on, zip up, and inflate.  I was concerned that my smaller 10-year-old son would have trouble seeing out of it, but he reported that he could see just fine.  There is clear vinyl just under the throat as well as under the chin for taller individuals.  We all had the BEST time walking around the neighborhood in these!  Even the neighbors and their kids came outside to see us.  We made lots of people laugh who drove by.I had a difficult time moving around in my costume, but it was only because I was laughing so hard at watching my two dino-kids run down the street ahead of me.  Our afternoon as a T-Rex family was one of the best days we've had in a long time.

title: Life is Better as a T-Rex!
product name: Rubie's Adult Official Jurassic World Inflatable Dinosaur Costume

text: I wear a size 18 pant and got the women's 1X/2X and it fits well.The plunge line is very exposing. The eyelets for the plunge are very stretchy so the ribbon that comes with it can't really close the plunge the eyelets just stretch. It does not come with the black string that is pictured it is a tan ribbon. I laced it half way up and stuffed the ribbon inside the dress and it looks good enough.The dress is comfortable.Depending on how much dancing you are doing, you may need some shorts underneath but it is long enough to wear without shorts if you aren't doing too much dancing and bending.The head piece is very large, I may have to pin it. It does have a stretch band but unless you have a large head or a lot of hair it will be loose on your head.Overall I'm happy with my purchase, just wish is was a little cheaper.

text: Although this costume it labeled as fitting "Adult - Standard" for the size, most adults will probably have a hard time wearing this properly.  I'm not overly tall being a 5'11" tall male but when I put this on, the feet end up just below my knees (see picture).  This is disappointing, especially being a product that is supposed to be endorsed by the movie franchise.  In my opinion, you'd have to be closer to 5' tall for this to fit correctly.The first one I bought through Walmart (it was cheaper than on Amazon), but returned it due to the feet being just below my knees...so I thought it was just defective.  So I bought one from Amazon, but it's the same way - too short!  The leg inseam to the costumes elastic ankle is only about 12 inches.  Now if I had narrower shoulders, I might have been able to pull my head and shoulders up into the costumes head area some more & possibly gotten the feet closer to mine.  But it's sized in typical Chinese dimensions, so everything is smaller than what is considered "normal" here.I still like the overall concept and look of the costume, so I'll just modify it to fit in my spare time instead of try and return it for a second time.
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2018
title: Made only for short adults...

text: I am happy with this costume. I like that it has a zipper. I was most hesitant when trying to figure out what size to order. I am no tailor, but I will include some measurements to help the next person decide on the best size.Also the tag specifies to hand wash cold. Only non-chlorine bleach when needed, Line dry, Do not iron. I haven't washed it yet.I'll start by saying that my daughter is 4 years old and about 41 inches tall. I measured her chest at 22 inches and she weighs about 41 pounds. She typically wears a size 5 in little girls clothing. According to the size chart it would have recommended I buy the S/P size for ages 4 to 6. I decided to go up a size and by the medium recommended for ages 7 to 10, and I'm glad I did. The next size down probably would have fit fine, but I'm happy with the extra room at this size.The medium (7-10) costume measurements I took are (approximately)...The  arm and chest length when my daughter held her arms out while wearing it is about 37 inches all the way from from cuff to cuff.The zipper is 21inches long.The seam from the armpit to the cuff is 12 inches.I am trying to add photos, but can't seem to right now.

title: Good costume
product name: Girls Cozy Bat Costume

I purchased three, one for myself and two for my kids.  The wow factor was great, lots of compliments and laughs and Jurassic World jokes. However getting around in these costumes proved problematic. You become over heated- so I recommend wearing a tank top and shorts- or something equivalent.  If you have long hair, put it in a bun, lots of static electricity in the head portion. The part of the costume where you see out fogs up a lot. We used these to trick or treat, and were exhausted by the time we came home. The kids did less then half of the houses they usually would do just simply do to the cumbersome nature of the costume and the continual fogging issue. However, with all that being said, these are fun costumes to wear- just not long term.
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2020
title: A mixed review
product name: Rubie's Adult Official Jurassic World Inflatable Dinosaur Costume

text: My 4 year old firefighter loves it! The name tag adds a special touch with room also for a small ID photo. I expected it to be paper but it's plastic like a credit card. The horn takes 2 triple A batteries and the sound is realistic like a fire siren but surprisingly not terribly loud. The extinguisher is light weight and has no sounds or anything which is fine. The jacket closes with velcro. It is light weight but not cheap feeling at all. The reflective material is functional and realistic. I do wish it was a little bigger, sleeves longer, as it now fits my 4 year old perfectly but my son is taller and comparison in size to a 5 or 6 year old. It's going to make a great Halloween costume paired with the firefighter rain boots I bought on Amazon and black pants.

I threw on my aviators and went to an 80's themes birthday party where there was Marty McFly, Andre Agassi, Axl Rose, and dozens of other stars of the 80's....and I won the costume contest with this! I hung it in the closet and will definitely be using it again in the future. This is the only costume I have ever fully recommended, which says a lot because I'm picky about quality and being a Top Gun fan, I'm a stickler for details...and this was worth the $$!I'm 6ft, 224lbs and the Medium/Large fit well...especially the arm & leg lengths. text: I looked at a number of bee costumes on Amazon and this was one of the most expensive BUT reading the descriptions of the others, it looked like they were vinyl apron-like garments that tie off at the shoulders. This one is a fabric (though a very cheap knitted fabric) shirt/tunic made to be worn over a long-sleeved shirt.  It also comes with the leggings, a nice touch. It is VERY roomy!  I am 5'8" tall & 175 lbs and it is very large on me, though not a problem because I didn't get it to look sexy.  I would have given it 5 stars, except the headband with the antennae is very poorly put together & guaranteed to break before the Halloween party is over. One of the antennae was detached before I even got it out of the package. I didn't send it back because I was able to reinforce it adequately with a black pipe cleaner. So - 1 star for poor antenna design/quality control. I completed the costume with a pair of the bee-eyes glasses, a black long-sleeved T shirt, and a pair of black leggings.

text: Perhaps one of the best costumes I've purchases on amazon ever.disclaimers:1. size is everything. I got a medium so it would be tight. it was. like ZERO room for error. I am 5'11", athletic build, 30"-31" waist, 175, and i have broad shoulders for my size. If you can pull this costume off (thank you TRX every day and rock climbing), do it.2. beware kids. even at a superhero gathering, kids actually thought I was Spiderman. (it's that good).3. the seams are what you'd expect, but I was still able to climb a rock wall, jump  over a ball pit barrier, and dance. try it on a few times, you will notice where the seams will start to pull if you have it "properly" tight. then just sew. there is an oddly placed one inch seam below the zipper and just over your tailbone. maybe to give room when you sit down (like in a car.... TEST THIS FIRST before going to your holiday party!). one little safety pin will do.4. the feet are narrow for the height of the costume. I wear an 11-12 and often wide. that is the MOST this can fit.5. roll this costume up slowly, getting every last bit of stretch out of it as you put it on. you will thank me. without this procedure, it didn't reach the (top of my inseam) and left a space, WITH this procedure, perfect fit and right to the top of my inseam.6. the zippers. if you have ANY chest or back to speak of, the zipper requires a friends help OR get a key chain necklace with a hook on one end and use that to pull it up. once it's on, it's easy to pull it down to the neck and show your head. but the costume is pretty good if you want to stay incognito.7. shockingly not too warm and not cold. like second skin. wore outside at first party til 9-10 PM (San Francisco) and inside at a hot club til closing. no issues.
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2015
title: PERFECT FIT (here are the tips for how to make it so)
product name: Amazing Spider-Man 2 Second Skin Suit

text: I bought this for my 5 year old grandson who is crazy about all things "fireman" ever since a "Real" fireman came for a talk at his school.  I wanted to get him a good quality firemans outfit, not cheap plastic, and the Melissa & Doug Fire Chief Role Play Costume Set came with a polyester/nylon coat that is heavyweight and actually can be worn as a jacket.  It is washable by hand or machine washable on delicates and cold.  The Bullhorn actually works with two AA alkaline batteries (he pushes the button on it and it makes a siren sound.  Unfortunately it does NOT actually function as a working bullhorn, which would have been MUCH better) and the "fire extinguisher" is not flimsy, neither is the plastic hat.  My grandson was so crazy about the outfit that he slept in the coat for several nights straight.  A REAL hit!The Fire Extinguisher and Bullhorn attach to the coat on the velcro waist strap.

text: This is a fantastic gift for a 5 year old, especially one that enjoys playing dress-up. We purchased this for our nephew, who has recently started getting excited about dress-up. He loved that this came with lots of tools – a stethoscope, shot, mask, jacket, name-tag, and a couple of other cool doctor tools. Some of them click and do something when played with, which he loved, and the stethoscope makes a heart beat sound when it's button is depressed (and batteries are added). Because this is much more than just a costume – it has all of the fun accessories with it that look real enough to a 5 year old – it is a really exciting toy. We thought this would be something he would play with for 5 minutes, but he spent an hour with it the first night he got it, doctoring everyone willing to sit for him. He called us a few days later (with assistance, of course), and he threatened to make a house call if we didnt come to see him for our appointment right then. We heard he dressed up and continued to play doctor to all visitors who came to the house over this past weekend. Who knows how long he'll continue to play with it, but he's already gotten so much time out of it and was so excited about it from the start, that we are so happy with the gift.We should mention that he did have an accident earlier this year and had to go to the ER for a few hours to get stitched up, and it was especially exciting to him to be able to play the role of doctor, after having that stressful but stimulating experience.
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2017
title: Comes with so many great accessories for dress-up!
product name: Melissa & Doug Doctor Role Play Costume Set

text: I was so pleased with this costume for my almost 5 year old son! My son decided he wanted to be a "spooky bat" for Halloween and when browsing for a costume to buy, I didn't look at this at first because I was turned off by the stockings/overall styling of the photo. It's really just a nice big fleece hoodie! So easy to put on and you can easily layer if you need to for a very cold Halloween. My son loved it and he got tons of compliments from his friends at school and his friends' parents loved it too. My son is very tall for his age and I struggled with what size to get but thanks to some other reviews I selected a size medium. It was a great fit! Big enough for layering and for him to be able to wear for a while but it didn't look too large on him either. For other clothing he normally wears 5T or boys size 6 for tops. I hope Amazon adds some additional photos of the hoodie by itself and on other kids (both boys and girls!) so it isn't so misleading as it is now with the current photo.

text: I bought this for pure unadulterated fun.  I'm a 54 year old woman and have wanted one of these for a couple of years.  I have worn it for several occasions and it was a blast.  My sisters loved mine so much, they bought one too.  Mine has a growling module in the palm of one of the gloves which was great.  The kids love this and the laughter is pure golden.  When you wear it, the legs really start at your own knees and the head extends about 2 feet above your own.  Vision is clear through the screen in the neck and movement is easy.  Remember, you're a mighty meat eating thundering T-Rex in this costume, but you also have the arms of a T-Rex, so don't expect to have a wide range of motion.  You will love this costume and have a blast.  I was NOT hot even though I wore this in the summer time.  One thought - use good batteries because the fan HAS to keep this inflated for you to have success.  Your costume will also NOT stay inflated if you don't have your arms in the sleeves and elastic around your wrists/arms so that air doesn't escape.  I'm sure this can be punctured but I was on the street, in the grass and even climbed a tree without damage.  The neighbors love this too.  Who doesn't love a T-Rex?
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2019
title: Best purchase ever!
product name: Rubie's Adult Official Jurassic World Inflatable Dinosaur Costume

text: My son loves this costume!  He used it for his Halloween costume, and he likes to wear it when he is playing like a construction worker.  He is 6 and tall for his age, but the vest and helmet still fit him.  (The safety goggles are a bit small for him, though.)  The vest looks very much like what a real construction worker would wear, and we have found that the reflective tape on it makes it useful for nighttime outings or bike rides, too.  The hard hat has adjustable plastic bands inside to make it fit more snugly for different head sizes, which is nice.  The only problems I see with it are that the adjustable bands tend to come apart from the hard hat so the little pegs have to be stuck back into it every so often, and the hammer and saw that came with it tend to fall out of the pockets easily due to the pockets not being deep enough.  However, the tools were one of the things my son liked best about this costume, and they have been fun for him anyway.
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2015

text: First, let's talk the fit. It was perfect.I am 5'8 tall and weigh 160 Lbs. I wear a size 10 in "regular clothes", sometimes an 8.I bought the Size Large Costume and it was perfect for my height and "larger" body.The red sash covers the middle so you can set it up in whatever way you feel best. I bought some Ninja Sais and tucked those into the red sash and I looked very authentic!The costume material is actually good quality. It did not rip, tear or lose its shape. The black provides a slimming effects and holds in those loose ends. I get nervous about " catsuits" but this one made me feel confident and secure. I wore for a party and it was the best. I did not worry about feeling fat all night or pulling and tugging at straps or a short skirt.Even so, I still received lots of positive feedback from my costume. I am actually going to just handwash it and wear it again for another party coming up.Important Points:Have a decent undergarment for the bust. The cleavage is cut low so be prepared to work with it if you have to wear a bra .My bra kept showing all night but that was my fault for not having the right bra. I will not make that mistake on this next party.Also, other buyers mention the straps on the arms and legs coming off and falling down all night. I did not have this issue. On the pants I actually took red thread and sewed the straps directly onto the leg. I just wrapped the straps up the leg firmly like the photo and then held them in place and sewed it on at random points. All night long, the straps stayed perfectly in place. For the arms, I did the same and on one I just wrapped it up the arm and then put a safety pin at the top. Worked like a charm. The straps stayed in place even with my dancing around and being crazy and acrobatic. You can do the same for the sash, so the sash doesn't keep spinning and moving around. If you follow those steps you should not any issue with the arm or leg straps falling and the material does not get "ruined" by putting pins in it or sewing onto it so sew away. Its pretty resilient.
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2014
title: Costume is Deadly Awesome for All body types
product name: Leg Avenue Women's 5 Piece Deadly Ninja Costume
