text: My 3 year old was looking forward to this for a couple of days before it arrived. The night ended in more tears than anything else, both for him and us. Others have commented on the horribly inadequate hat insert. This is an understatement. Sizing the hat down is not possible, it will not stay. Although it looks like similar to a resizable ball cap with pins and holes, the pins are smooth cylinders, not t-shaped or nubed like a ball cal so they do not snap into the holes. The slightest bit of movement and the hat adjustments pop loose. Or worse the whole inset comes off. Some kids don't mind, take the insert out and the hat flops around looking cute. My son knows it's important to wear his bicycle helmet on snug, so all helmets and hats now need to be snug. Frankly this hat ruins the whole experience and not at all what we expect from a Melissa & Doug product.

text: My daughter is a little fashionista/princess.  She loves this one.  The quality is great!  With other dresses with the wide shoulder look, I felt like the dress it's self kept slipping down too low.  This has a mesh that goes over he shoulders- so it stays up and is comfortable.  She's not having to readjust it over and over again.  I did buy it a size bigger than she needed, but that was intentional. Kids grow so fast, and I wanted for her to be able to wear it for a year.  I am glad I did- it's a little big, but she'll get to use it for at least a year- if not 18 months.

text: My wife and I share this Amazon account, so I will allow her to offer her thoughts on this product since she bought it for herself. But first, I will say that the level of sheer joy in our home exponentially increased moments after she donned the costume and inflated it fully. Here she is:Want to know how to shake things up in an Infantry Division during 0630 PT Formation? Order this costume and show up to terrorize the lazy out of some Privates!I'll admit, when I picked the package up from our mailroom I was a bit nervous. It was small and seemed like it wouldn't possible be large enough to fit. Before I even opened the package I checked my order history on Amazon to make sure I didn't accidentally order the costume for children. I didn't. I was ready to have to return the costume as I tore open the package, but was pleasantly surprised to find an adult-sized t-Rex inside.Getting the costume on took some work. I don't recommend wearing boot-cut jeans under it for two reasons: first, the feet of the costume are open on the bottom so you can wear shoes without wearing the bottom of the costume out by walking on the material of it. To keep the airflow from escaping through the foot area, the ankles are elastic... and that elastic is pretty snug. If you're wearing boot-cut jeans, there is a lot of material to get the elastic around. I was able to get the elastic over the jeans with some careful manipulation, but the ensuing bunching of the boot-cut jeans made for a pretty tight squeeze.I was worried about how thin the material of the costume is. We live in South Korea, and the temperatures are getting down in the high 20s (F). With a fan blowing air around the inside of the costume, and 20*+ weather outside, I was nervous that the costume would be miserably cold to be in. On the contrary! I was warm and close to sweating after wearing the costume inside our 68* apartment for less than ten minutes. This comes back to the second reason boot-cut jeans may not be a great idea. Go for something a bit thinner... maybe running capri pants?I have only worn the costume for a silly 20 minutes in our apartment to see how it fits and how it works. For your reference, I am a 5'9" curvy woman of 190 pounds and it fits well once it's on. Getting it on took a little bit of manipulation because there is no stretch to the material (specifically, putting my arms in the armholes after having my legs in completely). It wasn't a huge struggle... and I was able to don the costume by myself, but I will say that the costume does take a small amount of thought to put it on.I intend to wake some Soldiers up at PT in the morning in this costume. After doing so, I'll post an update to this review to reflect my thoughts. As of right now, this looks to be a wonderfully sturdy, hilariously fun costume. I can't wait to see what shenanigans we can make with this fellah!
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2016

text: Just the other day I was telling someone how Melissa & Doug products are first-rate, and now I have to eat my words.The doctor's suit is great -- my son (3 y.o.) looks so cute in it.  When he opened it on Christmas morning, he gave a big thumbs-up, and exulted, "yes!"  Just what a parent wants to hear!  He doesn't hang it up, though, and I've noticed it's starting to get a bit wrinkled.  I can't see him ironing it....I'm disappointed with the tools, though -- they're just not up to the Melissa & Doug standard I've come to expect.  The stethoscope in particular is flimsy plastic and I'm afraid it's going to break in no time.  It didn't work with the first set of batteries (2 x AAA) I put in because the springs don't contact the negative terminal when I put the lid back on.  I needed to get a different brand of batteries where the negative terminal extends over the entire end cap of the battery.  The other tools are reasonable (the ear scope is also a bit flimsy, but better than the stethoscope).Despite my reservations, my son loves it, and has had it on a few times, and it's only the day after Christmas.

title: Great dress-up, lousy tools

text: I purchased this set mainly for the hard hat.  It was very cheaply made and the adjustable band inside would not stay in the hat.  the adjustable strap could be made larger, but it was very limited on how small it could be made.  There were several tabs that snapped into holes to keep the adjustable band inside the hat.  One of these tabs was the wrong size so it did not fit all the way into the hole causing the adjustable band to come loose easily at that point.  I am afraid that this will cause the adjustable band to eventually be lost from the hat.  The pockets that were provided for the hammer and saw were too shallow, causing the saw and hammer to easily fall out of the pockets provided for them.  The safety glasses had a velcro connection at the back of the head but it would have been nice to have a sliding adjustment at the point where the elastic attached to the glasses. I would have gladly paid more for a more quality product.  I remember my daughter once telling me that Melissa and Doug toys are always well made.  I did not find that to be the case on this toy.  Frankly, I would have liked to send it back, however my 2 year old grandson would not have understood why Grandma did not let him keep his new outfit.

text: ReliBeauty really makes the best costume dresses for little kids. They are gorgeous, fully lined in cotton lining so nothing is itchy against your child's skin (for the sensitive ones like mine), even the sleeves are a soft chiffon type material, not that itchy fishnet mesh you can get on the cheaper factory costumes. Mine even held up to a gentle/hand wash cycle in the washing machine (not sure if that's recommended but my daughter wore it to school and spilled lunch on it). We didn't even lose a sequin and the stains came out with only Woolite! This is the 3rd princess dress I have purchased from ReliBeauty and finally left review because they are that awesome. We have Rapunzel, Belle and now Aurora. I'm sure we will be adding to the collection soon. You can't go wrong. Worth twice the money!

text: Dear Seller,I have now ordered this same item 3 times & it is becoming very apparent that you’re lacking in quality control when sending product to customers.Order 1.) my package appeared to have been previously opened & tried on (not a big deal), but then I noticed that the zipper was broken & the stitching around the base was ripped.It otherwise looked cute & decent quality for the price.But it runs VERY small. Definitely needed to size up 1-2 sizes. For reference I am 5’3” in height, with 26” waist, 36” hips, 34” bust and typically wear size XS-S.The size small I ordered fit around me, but was way too short in the torso - which is surprising because I’ve never considered myself to be tall at just 5’3” & I have a short torso. I returned this item & reordered in a medium in hopes that it will arrive intact & will fit my torso properly & w/out the dreaded cameltoe lol.Order 2.) Size Medium fit much better. The length is perfect & despite the legs being baggy around my thighs, calves etc, it would work....then I noticed that it was dirty. Maybe the grey stains across the front would come out if washed, but I don’t want to try & wash it then be unable to return & be stuck with a dirty item if the stains didn’t come out. So I decided to order a third time.Order 3.) the zipper was not stitched correctly so it is mis-aligned at the top once fully zipped. It’s just annoying!!! Plus I’ve noticed that the seller had increased the price since my initial order. I’m not sure if I should just deal with the flawed costume or try a 3rd time.Please stop sending damaged/dirty/flawed items. This is ridiculous.
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2020
title: Quality control & sizing issues
product name: Women's Lion Bodysuit - Lion Halloween Costume

text: I bought two of these for my 3 year old twin boys for Halloween, and then as dress-ups for thereafter.  My boys small for their age, and it's definitely big on them.  We had to roll up the sleeves on the jacket.  Otherwise, it's great!I am impressed that the helmet is a very firm plastic, unlike the cheap ones kids get from fire station tours.  It's adjustable too.  The bullhorn seems like its handle will crack apart pretty easily if dropped on a hard surface.  It accepts batteries that will supposedly cause it to make various fire-related noises.  We're waiting until Halloween night to put in the batteries though -- if we put them in at all.  The fire extinguisher's "nozzle" actually unscrews to reveal a hollow bottle, so kids can fill it with water if desired.UPDATE November 7, 2013:We put batteries in the bullhorns for Halloween.  They make one sound: a fire engine siren.  For some reason, I had expected several sounds.  The noise is not really as annoying as I anticipated.  It's not deafeningly loud.  The button to make the noise is in an awkward spot (even for adult hands) and our boys did not reach up to press it very often.  This saved us a headache, I suppose.I noticed one of my kids stepped on an extinguisher.  It flattened until I came and popped it back into shape - just like any plastic water bottle.The product description mentions that the child's name can be penciled on the name tag.  I used a Sharpie, which worked great.  The name tag is semi-gloss paperboard.

text: I'm 5'4 and 20lbs 'overweight' with a 36D bust. I wear a size 10 dress (in moderately sized brands) I have naturally broad shoulders and ribcage but don't carry a lot of extra weight in my ribcage and I have a smaller waist than most people my size. I ordered a Med/Large and would have been happier with a medium.I have a long torso for my height and the skirt hit 6-8inches above my knee. (I'd probably be 5'8 if my legs weren't so darn short.)I don't blame the manufacturer for this, because I was on the fence about a med or med/large and I figured bigger was better than 'won't zip'. The very long red ribbon gives at least an extra six inches of torso room if loosened. I'm going to have to work with it to get it to look better than my pic does.The area I'm most self conscious of is from 3' below my belly button to the bottom of my hip. Other moms know what I'm talking about. This costume was perfect for covering that area. The part of the top that ends in a 'V' shape doesn't reveal anything I don't like there.This dress fully covers a bra, which was a relief, because it's hard to find a strapless that holds the girls up.The fabric is thin, as you'd expect from a costume. It definitely shows a bra in back. I don't 'bulge' there very much, but it seemed to accentuate what does.I usually can't wear a plastic headband without getting a headache, but the one included is actually very comfortable.The petticoat is not included, which is clear in the description. The secret wishes scarlet petticoat 'often bought with' this costume was shorter than I'd like. You won't be able to see it unless the dress is pulled up, the petticoat is pulled lower than it should be (like my pic) or you bend over, which looks sexy in the bedroom, but I wouldn't reccomend the modest do in public with the dress plus petticoat. (I'm not modest so this'll be fun with a cute pair of undies. 😉)The reason for only 3 stars is the collar. It doesn't just itch, it hurts!! I have soft skin and I'm going to have to find something to cover it where it attaches or my skin will likely rub raw. I couldn't just knock off one star, because it really really hurts. 😕
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2016
title: Accurate fitting, Thin, Adjustable, OUCH, Does not include petticoat.
product name: Leg Avenue Women's 2 Piece Fairytale Snow White Costume

text: I am very happy with the quality of the jacket - that is the main reason we bought it for my son because who can be a doctor without the doctor's coat?  :)  The ID badge that you can personalize is a nice touch.  The surgeon's mask didn't fit him well but he didn't seem to really care for it anyway.  As many others have said, I didn't care for the stethescope's sounds.  It was a little freaky but mainly, it was sooooo annoying to hear!  All the tools, in my opinion, are just teal-colored plastic.  I didn't really like them when researching it online and I feel the same way with them in my hands.  Because of this we purchased the Fisher Price doctor's kit.  Kinda sucked to have to buy 2 items for basically one gift - and the M&D set was a tad pricey IMO for just the doctor's coat.It's a cute set, though.  I will warn any parents who knows their child will want to open this ASAP - there are red threads practically sewn into the coat to hold all the various instruments (for display purposes).  These were impossble to get off!  I had to use a knife/scissors combo and it was hard to do without cutting the jacket.

text: Overall I loved the costume and I was super happy with how it all turned out. The skirt portion of the dress is a bit thin and therefore a little see through, but I was wearing white leggings anyway so not an issue (I assume also not an issue if you're wearing the red skirt with it, which I did not purchase). It did need a solid steam to get the wrinkles out upon arrival, but that was no problem. My only issue was the size. I referenced the size chart and I am certainly not a 0/2 dress size - so I went with the S\M and not the XS. I ended up needing to pin both sizes a fair amount but it wasn't noticeable and ending up being totally fine. For reference - I'm 5'3" and 130lbs. I would happily purchase another costume from the same place, and just go down one size.

text: I was super excited to get this, Luckily one of the seller was prime 2 days instead of prime 6-8 days which make no sense.The item came in a bag which was weird but whatever. Everything look new, I think. I put in fresh batteries and the blower would not turn on. Try 4 more fresh batteries and still nothing. Normally I would return things that wouldn't work but I needed this thing this weekend and next week for office party and at my business. I decided to took the battery unit apart and everything tested okay. The blower however the wire was disconnected from the motor terminal and would need to be solder back in. Luckily I had my Weller soldering iron and did a quick solder and while I was soldering one of the terminal I touch the other terminal and it immediately snap. WTH kind of quality was that. I pay 60 dollars for this.

text: This is the Tyrannosaurus costume that I wore for Halloween. My 11 year old son was Deadpool and I chased him around our town. Hilarious stuff. We managed to get photographed and featured in the local newspaper. Anyway, I am 5 feet 8 inches tall 180 pounds and have a 42 inch chest. If the costume was any smaller, it wouldn't fit. I recommend that you allow this costume to off-gas for a while before putting it on. The fumes from the vinyl material can be brutal. Also, this thing does NOT breath very well so it's like wearing a sauna suit after a while and the view ports get fogged up. You can probably reduce the condensation by applying no-tears baby shampoo. Be forewarned: If you ever wondered what it's like to be a character at Disney, get this costume. Kids and parents alike will give you all the high fives you ever wanted (some kids might try to punch you in the balls).
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2017

text: This must be a Childs size! But I double checked the tag inside the costume and it even says adult standard size. I’m 5’7” and could not see out of the face viewer at all! It was way too low. After about 30 minutes (if that) I had to get out of the costume. Not only was the face completely fogged over but I wasn’t able to see my kids as they trick or treated. And after my six year old ran out into the street to cross it without looking, I decided Enough was enough. My friend that was with me stopped my kid but it could’ve been much worse. I was really disappointed this didn’t workout for me. This would’ve been a lot of fun but there is no way this is an adult size. I met up with other trex’s last night and seeing theirs compared to mine I realized that this isn’t my adult size that I needed. The quality seems pretty good of the sewing and zipper. The fan isn’t that powerful, yes I used fresh new batteries. But it doesn’t have enough power, remember I said the face viewer was fogged over. The painted/printed design on the material also had a lot of smudges. In several places. I just took pictures of a few. Would I buy this again? No, not for myself. For a child? No. The price you pay for what you get isn’t worth it. The fan is weak, the design is smudged and the roar device is way too quiet. I’d look for a higher quality item that might cost $10 more. It might be worth it!

text: I love this T Rex costume. I wear it a lot. I’m 6 feet tall and it fits well, someone taller then me might could fit in it but not sure on that. I have bought 2 of these. The first one wore out after about 2 years of wearing it all over the United States. One time I did have to get out of it fast because I was in high elivation and started having trouble breathing. But I have also been able to run in it for about half a mile or so before I stopped because of condensation. The one thing to use caution of with this though is to be careful when getting out. If you aren’t careful you can rip the material by the zipper. I did this and just sewed it back. You just have to make sure to lean over to avoid this. Overall, I would buy this again (I actually did). The price seemed to fluctuate on here so watch it for a little while before buying to get the best price. It’s best to not buy it around Halloween because the price seems to be highest then.

text: Third time trying to write this....my laptop keeps jumping me out of the review.  Anyway, this is a super cute costume that fit fairly well except in the upper arms, where it felt a bit tight.  There is some stretch to the middle and the velveteen is very stiff, not uncomfortable but stiff.  I paired the outfit with some black/white vertical striped leggings, black ankle boots with lace-topped ankle socks, a black net crinoline slip and a super curly tri-color brown wig NOT a clown wig. I wanted something bouncy and fun.  The top hat is super cute too and fit over the wig just fine without feeling like it was going to pop off so unless you have a head bigger than a bowling ball, it should fit and stay on just fine.  I expect to get many many compliments with this one!!!  For reference,  I am 5' 3" and usually wear a 2X ~ I bought this costume in the 3X-4X size which  fit around my big belly and with the velcro adjustable belt made me look more shapely., a nice extra bonus.  I LOVE this costume and recommend it to everyone!  Can't wait for Halloween!

text: I shopped around (at Halloween costume stores and online) and this is by far the best deal for the price. You get a hat, shirt, long socks, and a one-piece shorts/suspenders). Quality is right where it should be. A Large fit me fine at 5'8" 175 lbs (although I do prefer clothes slightly loose, Medium would've probably been a little tight, but that's my personal taste). The straps are adjustable for those graced with more height than me. You'll probably have to safety pin them in place (no biggie as they slide around, but women have been dealing with that for centuries). And the pant waist expands (luckily because I'm a 36" maybe 37" as I've started to put on my "winter coat" for the the colder season in the north east). Hat came a little smushed, but I put some paper inside it to pop it back out for when I'm ready. I have a pretty large head and it fits fine. ***For all those haters out there who give poor reviews and are expecting an actual Oktoberfest high-quality premium outfit (not a costume), go spend the $100-120 for the real deal and go cosplay. For those whose who like to have fun and will get some laughs at parties, not to mention multiple years out of a pretty well made product, this is for you. Happy Oktoberfest-ing!
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2019
title: Great product for the price

Both our son and daughter wear and like this, and it fits both of them (3 and a 5 year old).The only downside is the piece that keeps the helmet tight on your head,likes to come out.  Some glue keeps this in, but somewhat annoying.  Otherwise the race suit is very well constructed, the foam wheel is quite durable (although over time they will bend and discolor, but they are very resilient -- we have quite a few of these foam accessories).

text: I bought the medium size and I am 6'1" 185 lbs and it fits a little snug according to the sizing chart. The color is great and there is a spider graphic on the back. I may have been better off with the large, but it will work out.  I am breaking it in as it does need to stretch a little bit.  The zipper is not the strongest and the teeth do not lock together too well so you have to make sure you get it zipped all the way down the back of your head so the zipper does not separate. (My head might be a little large too) It is tough to get the costume zipped all the way up, but I used a wire hanger to hook the bottom zipper, grabbed the back of the costume to keep the zipper edges close together and pulled up.  Worked like a charm.  It is ok to see through, but I figured the vision would be a little blurry.  It gets tight around the ankles, again this should correct itself with a little wear.  The material is thin, but the seams are well constructed and tough.  I wouldn't yank on it too hard though.  No problems so far, then again, i have only had it for a day.  If there are any other issues, I will post to this review again.  If there are none, i will update this review after Halloween 2014.
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2014

text: Noticed the eyes didn't light up.  Looks like someone crossed the wires in assembly.  The usb cord goes into the fan unit and there are two wires coming from there that get hooked into the wires coming to the light up eyes with crimp "butt" connecters.  I saw voltage on the connectors so pulled the wires out and reversed, like magic the eyes worked..  Would have gotten a 5 star if I didn't have to rewire it.  Space left in the connectors so I was able to shove the wires in and compress those so I didn't have to use new ones.  Hilarious costume, everything else was on point.

text: I have just tried it on inside so far but seems great. When zipped up before turning on the pump, it seems like it might be claustrophobic but it isn’t at all when you use the pump.  FYI the pump is just this little lightweight square with a plastic belt clip connected to it, so it’s pretty easy to clip onto something you’re wearing.  Once you zip up and then turn on the pump, it takes maybe 1-2 minutes if that (maybe less than a minute) to fill up.  I’m 5’9” and I can put my head at either of the two areas with the clear plastic in order to look out (both around the dinosaur’s neck area). The head and mouth of the dinosaur are above my head completely so it’s nice and airy in there when the pump is going, and it’s even cool inside the dinosaur with the air going. Disclaimer - I haven’t run around in it so I don’t know if that will hold up. The dinosaur arms are pretty short but I think that’s the nature of the t-Rex - it seems like it’d be risky to try to pull your hands/arms up over your shoulders because I just don’t think there’s enough fabric there to allow that without possibly ripping the costume. The dinosaur legs came basically all the way down to my feet. There are holes in the feet, so the costume cinches around your ankles like cinched sweatpants would, and then the dinosaur feet basically overlay your shoes (the dinosaur feet are big enough that they completely cover your shoes so you really wouldn’t see what shoes someone had on). Your shoes then are completely outside of the costume, but everything else is in the costume except your hands and maybe a little part of your wrists/arms, but the costume comes with gloves for your hands. It’s a hilarious and awesome looking costume. I think someone 6’ or so would still probably be able to see through the top of the 2 areas with the clear plastic. Anything higher, you might still be able to fit in the open, airy head part of the dinosaur, but you’d have to scrunch to be able to look out of the plastic I think.
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2020
title: Hilarious, quick and easy, cool temp, non-claustrophobic
product name: Rubie's Adult Official Jurassic World Inflatable Dinosaur Costume

text: Based on others' reviews, I ordered a size up (I normally wear medium, but ordered a large), and that may have been a mistake. The length was good in a large, but I still wore leggings underneath just in case. The hood was rather loose / floppy, so the fake fur trim kept getting in the way of my eyes. I might've preferred to have a medium for this reason. If you're already planning on wearing leggings or something underneath it, you may want to just order your regular size. It's a cute costume and I will definitely reuse it. It's also very warm, which is great if you're wearing it outdoors. It may be *too* warm if you're at a crowded indoor party. One other thing to note - the bat wing sleeves felt slightly awkward while driving. I was afraid the seams might rip when I extended my arms to hold the wheel, but that did not happen. text: I got this for my son's fourth birthday as he loves firefighters. He put it on immediately. I chose this one over others on here because of the material that the jacket is made of. He also loves the toys that it comes with and he really likes carrying them around in the loops. The bullhorn makes a siren sound which is a little annoying, but he uses that and pretends he has to run to the fire and put it out.His six year old brother even likes it and he doesn't normally like dress up; I think I need to buy the police officer one now so they each have one. Both the costume and hat fit both boys. The only thing I do not like, is the hat, the adjustable strap on the inside keeps popping out so I keep having to fix it, and my son has a little trouble getting his tools back on the loops, but this was definitely a big hit, and I am so glad I got it.

text: Plastic zipper so cheap it wouldn't even go up once before it broke.  Not only the zipper itself but the zipper pull literally broke into two pieces.  No way I can even fix it.  This specifically says its a mens costume.  Its one piece from toe to finger to attached hood/ mask.  My son is 5'4" and it was tight from bottom to top.  He's 120 lbs with a 28" waist (skinny as a rail) and was skin tight but I suppose that's that it should be.  But height wise I wouldn't put someone more than 5'2" in it.  Left absolutely nothing to the imagination in terms of what was under it.  This was a size medium which was supposed to be a 42" chest.  Absolutely would not fit a man with more than a 34" chest.  My son has a normal size head and this was tight.  Not even sure it would have zipped around his head.  As zipper was broken we never got that far.But we were willing to put up with it being tight in every way.  The zipper makes it unusable.  For the price I'm stunned.  The fabric quality was OK.  About what you expect in a retail store Halloween costume, its not meant to be used more than a few times.  Design was good.  One piece with appropriate coloring in right places.  Feet, gloves and hood/ mask all attached which is  a plus or minus depending on your preference.  Size wise a foolish design because not everyone is the same height.Returning to Amazon.  Never returned a thing to Amazon before.  This clearly not Amazon fault.  Arrived in perfect condition, unopened.
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2018
title: Don't Buy!
product name: Amazing Spider-Man 2 Second Skin Suit

text: If you are ordering this from the link that advertises "Officially licensed Jurassic world t-rex costume fits a 42 to 44-inch jacket size with up 34 to 36-inch waist ", you will not receive that size. The package itself also listed up to a 44" jacket size, but once opened, it was clearly not an adult size costume. My wife is 5'4" (please, don't tell her I referred to her size as, "clearly not adult"). She was able to get into the costume, but it was a bit tight height wise. I am 6', but meet the advertised chest and waist size advertised. Before buying, I had spotted a review from a fellow 6' buyer, who quoted the item was snug in the height, but worked. I think he may have purchased his from a different link selling the same item, or there is a very loose size variable in packaging. I somewhat suspected the product would be a bit short, but upon opening the package, I didn't even try to put it on. It would have been silly to try. I had hoped that "Officially licensed" would also mean accurately listed. Still, the shipment was fast, the material is as advertised, and the item is returnable. If I can find one that is accurately listed in my size, I still plan on purchasing one of these outfits.
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2018
title: Size matters
product name: Rubie's Adult Official Jurassic World Inflatable Dinosaur Costume

text: My train-loving toddler loves this thing, but I only gave it 3 stars for a few reasons, first, the first set we received was broken/torn, luckily amazon accepted it back right away and we were able to get a refund and order a new one. Second, the hat seems pretty small. I have a 3 year old and he won't wear the hat because it is too tight, and he has an average sized head. Next, the walkie-talkie is SUPER LOUD and has no volume control, and the walkie-talkie plays train sounds, which doesn't make much sense to me. Finally, there are no directions as to what type of pens will work best on the tickets so we don't actually write on those when we play.I do like that it is washable (or so it says, I haven't washed it yet) and my child loves it, so that's what matters.

text: Max's wife here:I didn't buy this costume, but I did try it on at a local costume store the other day. It is a very cute costume and I liked the overall fit of it. I am a size 8, usually a medium in clothing/dresses. I tried on the M/L and it had a lot of room. I had to pull the sleeves up because it was big in the arms and the chest/stomach area was a little baggy. The only thing I didn't like was there wasn't much detail. The costume itself is cute, but would need makeup or a tutu/stockings to pull it all together. The dress is actually very thick in fabric, it is a velvet-type dress and is very comfortable. The collar accessory is big, and sat at the base of my neck (I have a very skinny neck in general, so it could've been just me). The hat is very very stiff, but I'm sure it would loosen up once you wear it or handle it. If you have the right supplementary accessories, it would complete the costume. I would add a skirt under and maybe some striped tights if I do decide to buy this costume! It's also long as far as costumes go. I am 6", and it hit mid-thigh.
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2018
title: Good fabric, lacks detail

text: I bought it because it looked cute, lots of reviews said it was comfortable, and I was tired of doing costumes I wasn't entirely comfortable in. 3 things I learned from purchasing this.1) I bought a size up because I wanted to be super cozy and comfortable. Even doing that, it was a bit tight and I was really disappointed when I first put it on. I was still able to zip it up, even if I felt like a sausage, so I ended up wearing it anyway. I wore some cute makeup to go with it and it made for a cute costume.2) The hooves are not the same fabric as the rest of the costume. They're like a stiff felt? or something? I wore this costume to work and the hooves over my hands made typing an awkward experience, lol. On the plus side, I kept want to hold my hands up and imitate hoof movements.3) This sheds. A lot. I had brown pieces of fabric all over my desk, chair, and floor. I have no idea how this will do after it's washed.

text: This costume was a lot of fun to wear and was actually very comfortable since it had plenty of stretch to it.  I'm 165 and 5' 2", 40C chest and a size Large fit me fine, though I did not wear a bra since the dress beneath was a bit snug on top.  The jacket fit as expected.  A couple a tweaks that I had to make, which were no big deal...  I turned the belt around so the velcro wouldn't pop open when I moved, and just moved the buckle over the velcro portion.  I safety pinned the jacket closed beneath the belt since it's only held closed by a tiny piece of velcro.  The hat pops up right after opening the package and looks great.  One thing, after about an hour the opening of the hat begins to stretch and fell badly over my face.  I'd recommend putting some kind of a little band in there to stop it from falling.  This costume is darling and has so much to it for the price.  I added the harlequiin Leg Avenue tights and my own boots. Purple lipstick is fun with this!!

text: When I got this, the elastic at the left leg was ripped and so was the top of the zipper so unless I held them tight, the air couldn't stay in and keep its form on its own. I didn't realize it until I bought another to get it in time for Halloween, but this was definitely already used when it had gotten to me. The actual new one that I actually used for Halloween, was nicely packaged in it's plastic, the little dinosaur gloves were tied together and with a label, there was a nice quality picture showing the costume, and it didn't have batteries yet.When I first opened the original, I was so excited I didn't realize that it was just jammed into its plastic and there were already batteries in it showing that some stranger had already put this on. What the hell. The original is going to be returned, but it was funny how the original costed about $60 and took maybe 2 weeks to get to me whereas the new one was available for prime so 2 days AND it was $10 cheaper so I at least had that going for me.The new one is great though, great quality and got lots of laughs and high fives from wearing though had to fix the zipper since it busted open the 3rd time I zipped it up.

My only real complaint is the police radio/walkie-talkie. It is SO LOUD. There does not seem to be any way to adjust the volume. My son finds it unpleasant and so do his parents and probably even the people in the apartment below ours. text: I had ordered this costume with 2 day shipping since it was less than a week before Halloween and I wanted to make sure I got it. I live in Canada, and got it in just over 2 days. The material is good, the straps are a bit loose (but there is velcrow, im assuming to cross at the back to make it tighter.) Looks exactly as pictured. I originally thought M/L would be too big, but I knew S/M would be too small. I've tried on costumes at halloween stores (of this brand and others) and have figured out that they run small. I was looking through other comments and not many mentioned the sizing. So M/L is definitely a medium and a smaller medium at that and so forth with the other sizes. I'm 5'7, 135 lbs and a 34d. It fit me pretty well on the hips and in the chest. The dress is short enough to be sexy but not short enough to be too skimpy or uncomfortable. If you're over 5'9 or 5'10 I probably wouldnt recommend this costume. THE COSTUME DOES TURN YOUR SKIN PURPLE AND ANYTHING WHITE.

text: Got a lot of compliments on it when it was working good, the fan isn’t really strong enough to keep the dinosaur aired up if you walk around very much, so it tends to deflate a little bit and you have to stop and let it reinflate. Also it fit quite small I’m only 5‘10“ roughly, and I had to crouch down a little bit in order to see out of the little window that’s on it. It also rubbed my four head raw because of the excess fabric where the Jolle meets the neck inside of the costume, it was constantly rubbing on my four head and not very soft at all. Since I wore it when it was cold out the viewing window fogged up constantly also making it hard to see. It’s still a very neat costume and gets a lot of laughs, my wife cries whenever she watches video of me in it because she can’t stop laughing, so there’s some good and some bad, but in this case I think the good outweighs the bad.

text: This was a SUPER cute costume!  But it runs very small.  I ordered a medium and the length barely covered my butt.  I’m 5’8” and  I range between a size 4 and size 6 in women’s clothing, and I am a bit curvy in certain areas.  Standing still it was okay but when I walked it kept riding up and I had to keep pulling it down all night.  Thank god for the jacket that came with it or it would’ve been a no go.The one other thing was that when I took it out of the package it was EXTREMELY wrinkled...it looked like someone had taken it out of the wash while it was wet, crumbled it up and put it in the packaging to ship out.  It says “do not iron” too!!  There was no way I could have worn it that way so I had to iron it...It took me 2 hours to try to iron it without scorching the material!!! I did scorch it in certain placed but that was way better than looking like a slob.  They need to at least attempt to fold it up so that it doesn’t arrive like that if they expect you to not iron it.  Other than that it was a great costume for the price!!

text: My wife and I each ordered one of these. I am 6’3”, 210lbs and I ordered a M/L. For me the fit was pretty true to size, a little on the short size, the sleeves about 4 inches too short, and a bit tight in the shoulders, but it will work. My wife is 5’5” and 125lbs and she ordered a S/M. It was way too long for her in the arms and legs. For some reason the torso for the M/L and S/M are the same length, so the bottom of the torso sat at her knees. We could hem the arms and legs, but this was a deal breaker. Unfortunately, we will have to return hers. It was a good thing we did order two of them though, because mine came with two Maverick patches and hers came with a Goose and Maverick patch so we were able to correct the patches for mine. Hopefully she can find something that will work for her. We would order an XS, but the size chart indicates that it would be too small for her and I’m guessing the torso would be just as long.

text: So, all in all it was well received. Lots of laughs. A couple of main points:1. You’d think it’s clear that you’re mocking the president, but it’s not. So a couple people were upset with me because they assumed I was pro-Trump. Which leads to...2. You’ve now invited political conversation on yourself for the entirety of the evening. Maybe that’s your thing, just be prepared.Even with all the laughs there’s a much larger downside: drunk men LOVE to punch trump in the face. Like, this alone will lead to fighting. I almost punched back after being hit in the balls for a second time. I also had drunk guys grab his head and force it into their crotch. Trumps head is basically one big target sitting just above your balls. Wear a cup, and be ready to brawl.Other than that, great costume!

text: As advertised, arrived a day early. I got the one without sound. The picture on Amazon looks teal, but it is gray.To put on: Sit down & put your legs in first. Then open the velcro on the wrists so your hands can be out to finish dressing. If you don't have help, you will have to turn the costume to get it zipped. I hooked the battery pack to the collar of my T-shirt. It has an elastic head strap you put on, which is handy to keep the head upright.👉 BIG HINT: tie a string to the zipper pull tab, because the zipper is in the back. You're welcome.💥No kidding, folks... it gets hot in there. Make sure you have an escape plan for cooling breaks if you are wearing this at events.All in all, so far, I like it.😺

text: I bought a princess Aurora dress from the website momapprovedcostumes.com but I was afraid it would not arrive on time for the birthday girl. I bought the Relibeauty Auroa dress as back up for the birthday in case the other didn't arrive. Well the other Aurora dress did arrive on time, it was pretty and was more play friendly, had a simple 1 layer skirt with no puffiness to it which is a bit easier to play in it. But hands down the Reliabeauty Aurora dress was far more beautiful than the momapprovedcostumes dress. It was more princess looking with the tulle glitter overlay, tulle underskirt, no itch skirt linin, and vibrant pink shimmer colors. Both dresses had the shirt style top so it was easy for on/off.  I was sad that I couldn't keep both dresses, but with amazon's free returns I had to return the Reliabeauty dress. I was already in the whole for paying extra shipping on the momapprovedcostumes dress. Maybe when we outgrow the momapprovedcostumes.com dress I will re order the Reliabeauty dress because it's gorgeous, well made, and comfy and it was better priced.

text: This costume is fantastic, I have to say. It wears well, and it does so for a good price. I was initially skeptical of buying this costume when originally shopping for a good Spider-Man costume. So, I read the reviews, weighed the pros and the cons, and looked at customer photographs before deciding to go for it. I have not been disappointed.I originally ordered this costume in, I think, October of 2016. Now, a year later, I am still enjoying the costume. I wore it to the Spider-Man: Homecoming premiere, and fans and friends alike enjoyed it! I also more recently wore it to a local community center play day for the kids. They enjoyed it immensely. And, as it comes to kids, I found myself doing all kinds of acrobatic things. I did hand stands, cartwheels, splits, and plenty of running around, and the costume has held up. And, at the premiere, I jumped onto things and off things (within good reason), and never had any issues with the suit. Definitely a win-win.Now, as others have said, the costume does have a red mesh where the nose and mouth are. And if someone is up close and personal, they will possibly be able to see your mouth and nose. It does, however, making breathing a bit easier, and doesn't detract from the overall appearance of the costume. And if you were to stand a few feet back, you can hardly notice it. The mesh for the eyes isn't the easiest thing to see out of, but it's not exceedingly impossible. In the daytime, anyhow. At nighttime, I probably wouldn't really attempt to walk around with the mask zipped up without a bit of help. Overall, not a deal breaker.I should probably also add that wearing an undergarment beneath your costume is probably a very good idea. I've stuck with a pair of compression shorts that aren't really visible and work well with the suit.One last thing regarding size-- we're probably all wondering "will it fit me"? Having ordered another super hero suit, I found that the other suit was appropriately slim-fitting, but still a touch baggy in the waist area. So, I went with a smaller size. As a guy who is 5'6.25" and 122 lbs, and who generally falls more into the large size category for a suit like this, I bought a medium instead. The medium is appropriately snug, but still allows for plenty of movement, and fits a bit better than my other super hero costume.All in all, if you're looking for a cheaper cosplay outfit or something to wear for Halloween or to conventions or birthday parties and events, this is definitely worth a buy. Perhaps not so much if you're looking for absolute screen-accuracy, but it definitely feels like you're stepping right out of the comic books the moment you put it on. Of course, the brighter colors probably help with that, and wonderfully so!

text: Ordered from begum9. Awesome experience! Expedited shipping was on time. I sized up according to reviews & wished I had not. I'm 5'4" & 128lb. Usually wear a medium. The large is fine but a bit over sized looking. The belt I will have to alter because it's so large that it won't go around me. I'm just going to safety pin it. Easy fix. Super cute outfit. Jacket is a velvet material & very comfortable. The bowtie is also quite comfortable. The skirt & top are one piece & a silky thin material but the jacket will definitely keep you warm. Skirt alot longer then I expected. Goes down about 4 fingers above the knee. I want it just a bit shorter for socks to be displayed so I pulled it up in the waste & the jacket & belt covers that up very well. Perfect!  The hat came nicely folded so you do not have to fix it at all. Open it, take clips off & it bounces to it's perfect shape. I love everything about this costume. Exactly as picture. It will be used for years to come. I picked up the entire outfit & am very happy with it all. Worth buying & would recommend.

text: So, my husband and I purchased 2 of these for Halloween costumes along with 3 of the kids' ones. Hilarity ensued. I can honestly say there wasn't a single person who didn't laugh their butt off when they saw us all. My husband, who is 6'5" was stretching the upper limits of fitting in this costume, but it's honestly easy to accomplish because the feet dangle and cover up a lot of space. I'm 5'9" and it fit me just fine. It was easy to put on, and pretty warm which was perfect for our cold Halloween. The only part of this costume I didn't enjoy is the viewing screen for your face. It's a great idea in theory, but in practice it fogs up REALLY fast and makes seeing in the dark a little difficult. Also, should your child spill their pumpkin full of candy on the ground... well... just imagine 5 t-rexs with tiny arms trying to pick up all the candy in the dark. Nuff said.

text: I purchased this for Halloween and it grabbed everyone's attention!  I also won best funny costume that day!  People just laughed all the time when they saw me tried to make copies or scan documents.  It is tough to use those little T-Rex 2 fingers to type email address on the scanner.  But I can take them off on my desk to type regular work.  If you worry about T-rex head is extended and may not able to fit in your cubicle, simply put the head on top of the monitor to rest so your eye level will be same to the monitor through the view window of T-rex.  It indeed was hot inside so you need to keep fan on all the time to feel cool down.  When you sit down on the office chair, just make sure to put the fan/wire on the side of waist so it operates well without you sitting down on it.  I am 5'2 I bought standard and it fits well except the leg.  It doens't full cover to my feet (See photos).  TuTu and the bow on the neck were not with the costume.  I purchased that separately from other vendors.

text: The costume itself in regards to design is amazing.  We had purchased this for a big costume party and sadly my grandson was unable to wear it that day because the zipper broke after he tried it one, it was unrecoverable because the quality of the zipper was very cheap.  We had planned to return it but our grandson had his heart set so much on wearing it for at least Halloween night so I bought a 45 inch zipper (which cost about $8 plus a bit of effort on sewing for 10 minutes) and we modified it to fit perfectly in place of the old one.  Not only did this fix fit perfectly, it enhanced the design of the costume.  We had a happy ten year old who wore it on Halloween and was getting compliments left and right!  It was a hit and with the new zipper, we feel it may last us for years to come.  I gave this two stars but if they had the zipper we used, maybe 5 stars...but overall, nice costume but poor cheap product of a zipper and not convienent experience with bad timing.  {Look at Brown Zipper on Front}

text: This looked GREAT in the photo.  Quality wasnt too bad (except the cheesy "necklace) but it didnt look good on me.  I'm middle aged and a bit heavy.  I saw a picture of an older guy wearing it and he looked pretty good so I thought I would try it.  The headpiece just lies over the top of your head.  I felt like it needed to come up just a bit before going over and back.  Plus the "skirt" was way to big.  I could have pinned it if I had liked how the outfit had looked.Unfortunately, I tried on the top and bottom to see what the fit was like as soon as I got it but I didnt put the whole outfit on.  This meant, as I was getting ready to go to the party, I realized I didnt like how it looked on me and ended up having to return AFTER Halloween instead of before.  I knew they would think I was just trying to get a "free" Halloween outfit but at this price, I decided to do it anyway.  I have to say, they did accept the return, that's why I gave 3 stars instead of 1.  It should be noted however that they charge about $5.50 for return postage.

text: This is almost too cute for words! I bought this for my 5 year old as a Christmas gift when she requested "bad guy stuff". After a lot of questioning we figured out she wanted to handcuff and ticket bad guys and I began to look for a police officer outfit. She is 48" tall and wears a size 7/8. She is really slim but this entire outfit is such a good fit on her and she still has another year or two she will be able to wear it. It is not so big it looks sloppy and the blue is so bright and beautiful. The hat fits her really good and she has a big head. I like that it is gender neutral because she has a 4 year old brother that might like to play with it someday. She carries her own dry erase marker with her ticket so she can mark and erase the offense. She really loves the whistle and laughs like crazy when she handcuffs her big sisters. I also like that it did not come with a gun. If you want your child to have one with their costume that could be a separate purchase but since we try to teach gun safety I like not having one she can play with and maybe become a little too accustomed to seeing and using.

text: This is the first halloween in my 35 years that I didn't wear something hand made. I just didn't have time this year, so I bought this.I have a degree in costuming, and I have to say I'm impressed. While there are a few small tweaks (like reinforcing the underside of the tail against abrasion, adding foot stirrups, and adding some ventilation holes in the mittens, which I would tack to the sleeves) I would make, overall I am very pleased.It looks really derpy, and I kinda love that. BUT you can make it look more scary and realistic if you lean forward. Bent at the hip till you are looking through the very top art of the face window, the shape actually resembles a dinosaur more than a cartoon. I did this a few times, but it's hard on the back. Mostly I embraced the derp.I had so much fun threatening all the other dinos at our halloween parade (you have to have a plan for meeting other people dressed just like you!). We amused many as we had tiny armed battles (our huge heads prevented any real contact) and a few decided to be friends and we danced, which more people loved.Some wearing notes: It's a bit of learning curve getting in without worrying you'll blow the zipper (I get my feet in, crouch down, and flip it over my head, then zip up) but once it inflates (a minute or so later) it's roomier than you'd guess in there. Tons of head room for me (5'6") . Now here's the downsides: it's a greenhouse. In the sun, you are baking. The window fogs up and you can't see anything but colored blurs. There is no ventilation in the mittens, and they practically fill with sweat. I'm cold-blooded. I like being warm... This is a bit too warm for day use of more than an hour. At night it was GREAT. My feet got cold, but the rest of me was comfy.The fan gave me about 6 hours of battery life over 4 days of use. Not great, but sufficient. Be aware that you need a tiny screwdriver to change the batteries, so be prepared for this with spares and tools.
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2018

text: I dread shopping for Halloween costumes because adult costumes do not fit me well, but teen/tween costumes look too juvenile for my taste. For reference: I am 5'4'', 100-103 lbs, and wear 25 W 32 L in Levi's jeans. I actually tried on this exact costume in a size XS in the Halloween store and it was a little loose along my legs and torso. I thought to look online and see if there were smaller sizes and I was pleasantly surprised to see that they carried this in XXS! Finally! An adult costume with a wide range of sizes!!First off, this costume fits me like a glove! It's so sexy while remaining classy and no part of the costume is see-through even though the fit is a tight bodysuit. For the price, you get 5 items which is well worth your money. The torso length was not too tight on me and there is enough stretch to fit someone taller than me. Additionally, the leg length is quite long with extra room at the bottom to spare, so it can fit people that are just as skinny but with longer legs. I have skinny arms to accompany my skinny legs, and the gloves also fit me perfectly without slouching down! The mask is just as comfortable and well-fitting (and perfectly on theme for the pandemic). All in all, I highly recommend this costume!
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2020
title: FINALLY an adult Halloween costume in smaller sizes!
product name: Leg Avenue Women's 5 Piece Deadly Ninja Costume

text: Kids love it

text: While many people will boast of Melissa and Doug's high quality toys, I often find their products very hit or miss. In my experience a lot of their toys are great conceptually, but fall short with sloppy, chipped paint jobs and/or lack of durability.That said, this costume is a clear winner for Melissa and Doug. The fabric quality and stitching for this fire chief outfit is top notch, and the added bullhorn and extinguisher are just the icing on top. This outfit isn't like anything you'd find at Party City (where costumes fall apart after wearing them just once). It's beautiful, bright, fun and a total bargain for $25. Pottery Barn Kids sells a similar outfit for three times this amount.My 3.5 year old will probably get a year or year and a half of fun out of this before he outgrows it, but I know I'll save it for his baby brother to enjoy someday too. The fire extinguisher and bullhorn aren't as sturdy as the jacket and hat, but they're in good shape so far after countless falls on hard floor.
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2019
title: Durable and fun outfit for a bargain price
product name: Melissa & Doug Fire Chief Role Play Costume Set

text: I was extremely happy with this product.  I bought it because my daughter wanted to be a fire fighter for Halloween, but all of the normal Halloween costumes had reviews that the material was thin... I figured they were just more like one-time-use items.  This had other good reviews about quality, and I was not disappointed.  It is made better since it is for year round dress up, not just one night.  Plus it is made well because Melissa & Doug is a good brand.The hat is made of hard plastic (not the really thin plastic kind you get at a dollar store) and it is sizable, which is great for my small daughter.  The jacket is thick and has real reflective material on it.  The bullhorn requires a couple of batteries (not included) and makes noise (it does not amplify the voice though).  The fire extinguisher is a nice size.  The cap is removable, so my daughter wanted to put water in it and use it like a squirt bottle, but it doesn't do that, which is probably for the best :).  It has a cute little badge and a place to write the child's name, which is fun.The size is good.  My daughter is 4 and very small for her age, and she does "swim" in this, but it doesn't look extremely big on her.  She will play with it after Halloween as a dress up outfit for a long time!
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2013
title: Excellent quality
product name: Melissa & Doug Fire Chief Role Play Costume Set

text: Nicely made, fun to play with. Bought it for a 3 year old. The speaker and the extinguisher are held in place by velcro straps which an adult has to strap back on each time they are taken off. I’m 5’5” plus I wore 3 inch heels and I was still stepping on it throughout the night. Also, there are two pieces— a stretchy shear gold body suit, and then the black and gold main piece that zips up on the top piece. text: This was the most money I had ever spent on a Halloween costume, but it looked high quality and it was the official Jurassic Park T-Rex and my son was going to have the same costume as his friends so there would be a bunch of dinosaurs running around. We tested it as soon as we got it. Worked as it was supposed to. Made him take it right off and kept it packed up until Halloween night. Halloween night, got to the friends house, he put his costume on. The other boys put theirs on, but only minutes later started having trouble with the fan not pushing enough air to fully inflate their costumes. The other dad sat and worked on them for about 20 minutes. While we waited, we went to the first house and while posing for pictures, my son's also started deflating. All 3 boys had to scramble and find some masks just to look like they did SOMETHING for Halloween. And my batteries were my "good batteries", brand new. There was no reason this should have ruined our Halloween night.

text: I'm so glad I ordered this product! I waited & debated, then Amazon went out of stock so I pulled the trigger once the item was a slightly higher price, almost out of stock & not prime & I don't regret it one bit.I'm a curvy, top & bottom & am 5'6. I ordered the large since I normally wears jean size 31/32 again curvy not super skinny jeans & it's perfectly tight around my waist.I also plan to wear with thick leggings or black jeans depending on the weather. So I tried on over my normal jeans for the review.It's a snug fit so if you're going for a looser super comfy fit then order 2 sizes up.The product hits me mid thigh, in the front. A little too short in the back for me to wear alone, but you could get away with it especially with a short pair of running shorts on underneath.Upon opening the shipping envelope I was slightly concerned it'd be tough fabric that wasn't soft as the packaging is a no frills basic Halloween packaging, but fabric is soft & comfy. Only a few strings from seeing to trim which is not a big deal at all.Also has the great V neckline, even if it's zipped all the way up it doesn't go above a what a normal v neck shirt would and the fur goes all the way down to the zipper. The zipper doesn't have a second pull from the bottom so don't expect that.The ears on mine stand up without adding any additional support as they are stuffed so full they have no option but to stand up.There are also nice details I was surprised by like the wing hooks off the sleeve and the stitching that outline what would be the bats bones in the wing.There is also a v that goes down in the front and back, almost like a onesie that's unbuttoned (if a one size was a V) to account for the bats body I guess.All in all I'm super happy with the purchase and excited for Halloween. A simple yet cute outfit that I can definitely wear year after year.I cannot confirm enough order a size or two up & order it before it goes out of stock if you're debating on getting it at all! 😊Will try to update with pics later.
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2015
title: ORDER, but a size or two up!
product name: Leg Avenue Women's Cozy Bat Costume

text: Sadly, only one star because my kid couldn’t use it for Halloween. I ordered this costume several weeks ago and when my child was trying it on we discovered that the zipper was broken. I returned it and immediately ordered a new one. When the new one came in, there was once again problem with zipper alignment. It’s a different problem but it still has to do with how zipper is sewn in. So returning the second costume. Very sad, because otherwise this looked like a high quality item made of good material with sharp graphics. The only way to make this work if the zipper is broken is to completely and totally tape the zipper seam shot. If you make it airtight  enough with tape, you have a chance of it bowing up correctly... But in this case it is not suitable for a child because they would not be able to move around with tape all over. In any case, when you’re paying this much money for a costume, you wanted to work as expected.

text: The monkey costume arrived promptly and I just tried it on.  I am 5'3," 147 pounds and wear a size 10 jean. Oh, boy. The XL has me sucking in my gut when the sizing chart indicated a more roomy fit.  The face of the monkey is blemished with reddish marks and I can't tell if it's makeup (I don't wear makeup) or some kind of fabric dye....anyway, I tried to clean it with a toothbrush dipped in  a bit of laundry detergent but the mark seems to be permanent.  If it weren't so close to Halloween, I would request an exchange but I guess I'll just say the monkey is blushing. As people have mentioned, the tail is heavy so if this is a costume you want to use continually, consider replacing the stuffing with a lighter weight batting. text: My three year old was thrilled when I told him his costume had arrived and we were both very excited to find this high quality jacket, hat, bullhorn, and extinguisher in the package.The coat is a thicker fabric with real reflective tape (a big plus since it will be his Halloween costume) that seems like it will hold up well for a while to come. The hat is also a thicker, hard plastic of good quality. The fire extinguisher is a good size and looks realistic though I wish you could squeeze the handle for the full effect. I haven't even had a chance to put batteries in the bullhorn yet but it is also a good size and seems like a quality product.He is a pretty average size three year old boy and the coat and hat both fit him well with room to grow into it without looking oversized. His only complaint is the hat is "too heavy" but he's used to a flimsy, plastic one he got at a party so that is relative.I don't usually write product reviews but this one really earned a shout out for being a quality product that was exactly what my son & I were hoping for!

text: This is a great costume! Great material, hemming, details and durability. It was simply beautiful and i received so many amazing compliments. I wore this for a company party and had children coming up to me for pictures. so sweet!Other reviews are accurate that this is very long. I am 5'5, and even with 3" heels, it still drug at least 3"+ on the floor. Unless you are 6', you will likely have to shorten this. Also, the upper portion is very stretchy to give you extra comfort, but don't let this fool you to get a smaller size. This is for comfort.To be helpful, I am a very curvy 5'5 woman. My measurements are 36 DDD chest, 33 waist, and 43 hip, and 188 lbs. I ordered a Large and it was perfect. I will emphasize that I have a small waiste compared to my other measurements and weight, and this is why the large was comfortable. This is a fitted look up top, so it you have a waiste larger then a 36, I would probably go a size larger to be safe.This did come with the headband and black necklace, I had to buy my own long white gloves.All in all, a super adorable and great for the price, costume.Oh, be aware, you will be shedding glitter everywhere you go. If possible, take this out of the package outside to shake out, or in a bath tub to rinse down. My bedroom was full of glitter, as well as my car. Lol

text: My almost 4 year old loves his construction costume. He doesn't seem to mind, but there are a few things that I think were poorly designed in comparison to the other M&D costumes we have. Also, the inside piece for the hard hat (I'm sure there's a term for that piece) does not stay in the hat and does not stay fastened to stay on my son's head. text: Heads up on the sizing: as listed on package, Medium fits 5'0" -5'4", large is 5'5" to 5'10", X-large is 5'11" to 6'3". I originally ordered the medium but sized up after reading the package. Whew.Now that that's out of the way, this is the suit you're looking for. Unbeatable price. Plus, it is all one piece which means no losing gloves or awkward sneaker wearing with the suit. Spider-man will be cohesively himself. The eyes are easy enough to see from, but my long eyelashes are just a little bothered by the mesh so close. Obviously this isn't the manufacturers fault. One complaint is the way the feet fit, they were made too tight over the front of the ankle and will have to be worn in for a while before fitting perfectly. Picture added soon.The feet have a thicker fabric on the sole, but not to the extent that i would wear outside for extended periods of time. A friend has glued soles from watershoes under the feet of his suit, and that seems like the best way to go about keeping the authentic spidey look with a bit more foot protection.I would recommend a light shirt under the suit, as well as compression shorts or running shorts, for comfort and modesty. Not really the most covering outfit. That said, all in all it is a strong recommendation from me.
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2017
title: Definitely order, but order a size up.

text: If you're on the big & tall side like myself, you're probabaly hesitant to purchase this, especially since Halloween costumes historically run small. (I know I was!) however let me assure you that it does fit me just fine, and I even had some room to spare.That being said, The legs and arms have an elastic on them to keep the air in. This can be rather tight depending on how large your ankles/wrists are.Getting into the costume wasn't too bad at all; I was expecting much worse due to reading the other reviews. If I can do it being 6'2, I'm not sure what others were doing wrong. Here's what I did to get it on quickly and easily:-Lay costume on floor, zipper facing up-Insert legs into each leg opening-Crouch into a ball (hugging your knees)-CAREFULLY bring the costume up over your head-Once fully inside, ensure fan is on, and zip up-Finally, put hands through arm holes(Same process in reverse to take it off)Lastly, I will confirm what others have stated. It gets hot inside. Very hot. I only wore the costume for 5 minutes to test, and I was already sweating. Hopefully this won't be an issue since it will be colder in October.The costume seems to be well made, and all parts were included.Please excuse the poor picture - due to the Trex having short arms, they are inherently bad at taking selfies.If this was helpful, give a thumbs up. :)
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2016
title: 6'2, 240lbs, and it fits!

text: My kids both wanted to be dinosaurs for Halloween this year.  The my 13 year old went with the T Rex, and the 10 1/2 year old chose this velociraptor, and the sizing is tough, because you have to be really short for the child's one to fit, and he was about 3" too tall.  I figured being too tall would be worse than having it large, so even though he's only 4' 9" or so, we went with the adult size.  He JUST BARELY can wear this without it just being too large.  He's a tiny kid, so it take a while to get the thing to inflate around him, and the motor has a bit of a problem keeping it adequately inflated so it is stiff enough to wear.  That being said, these type of suits are never going to be easy to move around in, that's kind of the point.  The issues my son has with it is 1) the zipper is in the back instead of the front like with the T Rex one.  This makes it very awkward to get into and zipped without assistance.  2) the T Rex has removable gloves, so you can wear them or not, and the velociraptor has its hands attached.  I was going to cut them off and sew elastic to the wrists to have it like the T Rex, but then we discovered that there is actually velcro at the wrists so you can pop your hands out.  This is nice except the reality is problematic because for starters, you have to close the velcro as tight as you can around your wrists to keep the air in, and the velcro is scratchy as all hell and hurts the wrists.  Not only that, but the velcro section is tight to even get a 10 year olds hands through, and putting them through is a scratchy experience too.  We cut the toes out of a couple of socks so he could put them on his wrists to cushion from the velcro, and those makeshift wrist guards should make it wearable, but it also has the added detriment of having floppy second pair of hands next to your hands when you put them through so you can actually use your hands.  So, I would recommend staying with the T Rex version.  It is just designed better.  Not only the above, but the velociraptor also has a longer head/nose.  So the nose is often dipped down more into the field of view, making it harder to see.  Granted, this might not be a problem if a full sized adult was wearing the adult costume, but I'm here giving my thoughts so there it is.  It's still pretty dang cool, and fun, so I'm giving 4 stars instead of 3.  Just buyer beware with this one.
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2019
title: Velociraptor has a couple of flaws
product name: Rubie's Adult Official Jurassic World Inflatable Dinosaur Costume

text: I know I'm posting this after Halloween but I still like to review things and there's always next year, or costume parties....or dress up time. I had intended for my newly turned 2 year old to be something else but he saw his big brother in a Catboy costume and got super excited. His brother suggested he be Gecko and he started jumping around shouting "Gecko!". So I bought him a second costume! He LOVED it from moment 1. We live in the North so it has to go over clothes for Trick or Treating. The fit was pretty spot on for him but he's not large for his age at all. If your child is a larger 2 year old you might want to size up. It's thin but the material makes it fairly warm still. The removable tail is a nice feature. We got SO many compliments on how cute our little guy looked in this though he kept tripping in it, I blame the mask. But he was having so much fun we didn't take it off. The CUTEST part of this costume with a little guy is the tail wiggling back and forth as they walk/run. I actually took a video of just him from behind and everyone thought it was the best Halloween video they'd seen bc it was super cute and different from actually seeing the kids faces, haha. I plan on letting my boys play with their costumes as long as they fit in them, should be perfect on snow days if we are inside.
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2016

product name: Gekko Classic Toddler PJ Masks Costume, Small2T

text: To start with, I'm not huge on dressing up for Halloween, but my roommates decided to throw a huge Halloween party so I kind of had to. I'm a huge fan of Top Gun, so I decided that I'd dress up as Maverick. I looked all over the internet for a costume, and stumbled upon this one. It seemed like a pretty good product, and I was correct. This costume is pretty awesome and feels really legit. I do like the interchangable name tags, so one person can be goose and the other Maverick.I'm about 5'10" and 190lbs. It was a little tight around the back, so don't plan on doing any physical activities with it. It did get a little hot, but I live in North Carolina, so keep that in mind. I plan on wearing a yellow bra or lacy yellow bralette under it. The tail is kind of heavy but doesn't really bother me. The hoodie part is pretty big. You have to rest it on top of your head otherwise it covers your whole face. A few bobby pins can fix that though. It is a little bit longer than fingertip length but it doesn't look weird unless maybe you are shorter. It would be an easy fix though if you hemmed it.Overall for the money it was what I expected and is really cute. text: I think this is a nice, well-made costume.  I am happy with the price I paid.  But, as others have stated, this runs very small.  I pretty much always wear a size medium.  Because of reviews, I purchased an x-large.  I am planning to wear this while my husband is a fisherman, one child is a crab and the other a fish.  I ordered the largest size because I would rather it be loose than tight.  I can zip this up fine and it fits like I was hoping.  But, like I wrote, I am usually a size medium.  X-large with this costume is not x-large at all.  I wouldn't advise ordering this costume at all if you wear more than a medium size in normal clothing.  I am happy with this costume but am glad I read reviews and ordered up 2 sizes!The arms are long and loose on me (they look tighter on the model than they are on me).This zips completely open like a jacket which is different than what the current photo shows.I am 5'5" and it hits me right at my knees, which I am happy with.  I wanted it to be longer on me than the model and figured she is much taller than me.  I am going for just the shark look, not the sexy shark look, haha.  The fin is on my butt.  The zipper in the front makes it look kind of bumpy but I don't mind it.  It just depends on what you are looking for.  If you want a fun, funny costume or one to wear with your kids, I think this is good.Oh, and according to the size chart I should have ordered a medium so I definitely would not pay attention to that.
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2015

text: When I saw this costume on Amazon, I just knew that I had to have it for Halloween even though it was only May. Over the years, I have a hard time finding costumes that I like and this one just hit the mark. It is creative and fun not just for the wearer, but for others too. So far, my family has gotten a good laugh and gives the wearer an opportunity to have fun acting out quick alien abduction scenes. I can't wait until Halloween to entertain party-goers and trick or treaters. I'm 5'11" and 180 lbs and it fits well. One more thing, I like the fact that it is open-faced for the wearer. It gives me an opportunity to wear a creative costume yet eliminated the need to use a mask or makeup. So it is a clean and comfortable walk away at the end of the night. Also, the open face does not inhibit eating or drinking at the party which has always been a negative in wearing a mask. It came packaged new and just like an item you would buy at a big box Halloween store.

text: I love this hoodie. After spending nearly $200 on a costume for Halloween, I saw this advertised on Amazon and just had to have it. It is so decently priced, I returned my other costume and bought this one instead and I am so glad I did!! Saved me a bunch and is even more cute than my previous costume!I am 5'5.5" and 135 - 137 pounds; kind of a busty hour glass shape. This large hoodie fits me *perfectly*, just a little snug with a bit of space for wearing a sweater dress or something underneath. I could probably had bought a medium if I didn't want to layer under the hoodie. The length reaches just at a point that if I bend over it doesn't show my bum but I still will probably want to wear opaque leggings or short shorts under this just in case. My only wish would be to make the sleeves just a bit longer, but that is more personal preference because I have longer arms.The hoodie itself is better than the photo examples on Amazon. If you look up "leg avenue bat costume" on Google you will see that the hoodie's zipper actually goes all the way down and can open fully. It also is full fleece material, so it's insanely soft and warm. The hood is big, and looks great both up or down. The wings are super thick, not flimsy or cheap looking. Keep in mind this hoodie is very, very warm. It will be much too warm for anyone who gets hot easily, but perfect or someone who is worried about freezing outside on Halloween.This whole costume has a casual feel to it because of the cut and material, so this would be great for a casual Halloween party, for a teen who is trick or treating, or just someone who loves looking like a bat (judgement free zone here)!I posted this comment before Halloween so if someone is on the fence on buying this hoodie, i wanted to help that make the right choice. Go with this hoodie! It's awesome. I plan on posting reference photos post Halloween.
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2015
title: AHHHH I love it!
product name: Leg Avenue Women's Cozy Bat Costume

text: I absolutely love this costume! Cannot wait to wear it for Fantasy Fest this year. However I rated this 4 stars because my package was missing 4 items (arm cuffs, headpiece and necklace.) I have contacted the seller to send me the missing items.UPDATE to 5 Stars: Seller responded quickly and assured me the replacement items would be sent. I received the package and not only did I receive the missing items... I received the whole costume again! Now I own two which is actually perfect for my roommate to wear. Thanks Dreamgirl... or shall I say Dreamguy? ;)Now for the costume: I'm really only wearing the skirt, headpiece and cape. I like the costume better without the shirt so I won't be wearing it. The arm cuffs are too big (expected this, I have small wrists) so I ordered gold metal bracelets to replace. The necklace is very cheap, basically just a triangle of fabric glued to a string. I ordered a real metal necklace with the eye or horus to really make it stand out. Lastly I ordered similar gold gladiator sandals to complete the look! All in all I really like this costume and the fabric is really soft. Price could be cheaper, but all costumes are expensive.
