text: I ordered a size small toystory jessie costume from amazon.com through costumes4less on wednesday morning the 26th, When purchasing this product in the buy section I made sure to purchase this product with a 1 to 3 day shipping to make sure that it was there by saturday the 29th the latest.  My son really wanted me to dress up with him this year, and i was increadably excited to be Jessie with my little man being Buzz Lightyear.  After purchasing this product I went to check the status later that night after getting off work around 2am to find that the guarenteed delivery by the 28th had changed to anywhere between the 28th and november 2nd, I was then very disapointed in this company, no one wants to recieve thier halloween costume the day after halloween, expecially when they paid the extra money to recieve this costume in time.  I periodically checked the tracking on this product to find that it was in NC from 3am to 11pm without moving then the same thing the next day in SC then in GA for a whole day also, in my life I have never recieved such bad customer service, for when i called costumes for less they said it was only an ordering answereing service but i could call back on monday (HALLOWEEN DAY) to speak to someone who could handle my call.  Had I known that this would be the way everything would be handled, I would NEVER of purchased this item.  I probley would of accepted it had it arrived on halloween so I could go trick or treating with my little one in costume, but it arrived on November 1st around 1pm which i quickly told the ups guy that I am refusing this product that had a 1 to 3 day shipping almost a week ago, I am expecting a full refund including the shipping cost since I paid extra and WILL NEVER ORDER ANYTHING FROM COSTUMES4LESS AGAIN.
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2011

text: You will not regret buying this for your preschooler. My 4-year-old son put the jacket and hat on and was instantly transformed! He spent the rest of the night placing the lot of us under arrest and in handcuffs. This policeman jacket set is made of high-quality, machine washable fabric, and so is the hat. The accessories are a walkie-talkie (requires a 9v battery for activating the sounds), a set of handcuffs, a police whistle (which isn't too shrill, thank goodness), and a shiny police badge. The ID card and "ticket" is not made of cardboard and meant to be taken our of the pocket and put back in hundreds of times.

text: my husband has wanted one of these costumes for years. finally they halved in price and I scooped one up for a surprise. he has worn it at least once a week since. after seeing it, one of his friends ordered one and now they do t-rex things together: go to the bar, the bowling alley. he took it dancing at a club, it was a huge hit for the 30 min he was able to wear it before he almost literally melted. it IS hot inside. you will be drenched in sweat if the temp is above 40. and even if it's not.. the suit will still be warm inside and the water will condense in the head of the dinosaur and occasionally rain on you. the windows fog up. still worth it.my 8 yr old has worn it to dance in our driveway for his brother's schoolbus, and to amuse people in our subdivision as they drive to work. you can see them cracking up in their cars, it's hilarious. when son wears it, the haunches pretty much rest on the ground and he can just see out the bottom of the chest window. husband is 6', wide shouldered and 240#. I knew we would be pushing the limits of the suit but it does fit. his shoulders are up inside the neck a bit which makes for a really tight fit. and the legs end a little lower than mid-calf, but the feet flopping down help hide that.they've been posting t-rex exploits on facebook and everyone I run into comments on how much they like it. I thought these were pretty popular costumes, but I'm surprised how many people have never seen them.  my boss even got one after seeing the videos- for Halloween he stood still in his yard and pretended to be a blow up lawn decoration, then scared the crap out of people when they got near him. he's 5'9 and slight runner's build, it fits him perfectly.ONE CON: the seam above the zipper has let loose twice on our suit. I had seen this in the reviews. the first time I stitched it up and it ripped out again. the second time I stitched it up and also stitched the top of the zipper together (above the teeth, so it doesn't affect the working of the zipper at all). sewing thru the thicker material there holds everything together much better and that seam hasn't split since.
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2016

text: It is a really nice costume! I'm 5'6" 140 lbs. My cup is a DDD. I ordered the Small Medium. The chest area is snug, but it doesn't hug my waist quite how I wanted it to. It's a little roomy. However, I have troubles with fits everywhere I go because of my curvy figure. It's a beautiful costume, and I am so excited to wear it! I usually wear a medium in adult clothing, but the small medium was a little big on me. If I were to order the X-Small, it probably would be too small on my chest, but just perfect for my waist. It's a gamble, but when in doubt go 1 size smaller than you think would fit you. Probably not 2 sizes small, and DEFINITELY not a size bigger than normal. Length for me was just like in the picture.

text: Wow! Can you imagine one of these police ladies coming towards you? Maybe if she pulled you over, it may make for a fun night! YEAH RIGHT- Buddy, that's only on the internet.This is a horrific female stereotype. Police officers are here to serve and protect. They risk their lives on duty every day for the general public. No police officer would show that much skin. Need to do a high case on foot? Gurl - not in them heels you're not. You know what else is sexy? Getting handcuffed! Getting arrested! So much fun! We should sexualize this for the fun of a holiday that was never meant to be sexy, or any other time. If you're on duty, what if you get shot? I am telling you sister (or brotha', if you're into that), that push up bra is nothing like a bullet-proof-vest. Police batons? They were outlawed many years ago for a reason. Glasses inside? because it's sexy - Im sure that will make it easy to see when you need to serve and protect the people and not your sterotypes.Stop the stereotypes, stop the sexulization of respectful people. Take it down

text: This set is very well made of high quality fabric with and child tough stitching.  The velcro fasteners make it easy to put on and take off.  Although the tools are plastic, they are still functional.  The walkie talkie requires a battery in order to work.  It lights up, and says something unintelligible and has a siren sound.  Might be better suited for a police role play suit than a train engineer.  The name tag and train schedule are plastic coated and appear to be for dry erase markers.My five year old grandson thought it was great and he wore it when we took him on his first real train ride.  I would recommend the Melissa and Doug role playing outfits to parents and grandparents as they feed a young child's imagination and serve to open up numerous educational opportunities to involve children in something besides video games or TV.

text: Ordered it for my 3 yr old for Halloween 2010. He's of average height and weight so this fit perfectly. Unless there's a growth spurt, seems like he'll get to use it for another 1-2 years. It's a well made product, as good as the real thing and way better than the cheap vinyl outfits you see in discount stores. The yellow reflective tape shines bright. I especially like the helmet since it is very sturdy (a kid could stand on it without denting it) and has straps inside that snap together to fit around the head so air can get under there and they don't sweat. The bullhorn and extinguisher attach to the jacket with velcro wraps. It's useless tying it on since they make the outfit bulky. Haven't put batteries in the bullhorn, just to save our sanity! I'm sure it works. Your kid will sleep with this at night if you let them!!

text: I love the consistency in Melissa and Doug toys. Its hard to buy things online but when I see a company like this I just know that I will be happy with the product and they did not let me down this time.I bought this as a halloween costume for my son (who is three), which he wore this year and loved. But it also is now in his toy bin and when he is feeling heroic he will put it on.The things that I love about it:-although a tad big it fits my son fine at the age of three, but also can be worn for the next few years.-the helmet is adjustable on the inside to fit a ranges of head sizes- The personalized name tag is a cute addition and very fun and unique-it comes exactly as it looks like and the quality is great and sturdy- reflective tape made halloween fun and safe which was a really awesome feature to have-the mega horn makes noise and comes with batteries.Things I would change:- the megaphone and the fire extinguisher were a bit heavy on the velcro belt hooks and dangle, it made it impossible for my son to comfortably walk around with them all night and so they were abandoned before we left for the night-the fire extinguisher is non functional what so ever and is just plasticthis will be easy for me to resell in a heart beat and I am fine with the price with what I got. I already had the fire boots so it was easy to put warm clothing and black sweat pants and my son was looking great this year! anything that inspires imagination is perfect in my book!

text: I was very excited to get this costume. WARNING TO BUYERS: The entire back of the costume is solid pink, and not even a pink that matches the front. Very disappointed in that. I like the fact that it came with the wig and gloves, although I won't be using the gloves. The wig is made of bright red yarn sewn onto a piece of red material for the cap. Please be aware the amount of yarn on this wig is so sparse that you see the wig cap all over. I will be adding more yarn to cover that problem so for me it's not a huge issue, just a inconvenience. But if you are not able to spend the time doing so I would recommend getting a regular wig instead. I have made in the past a complete yarn wig (cap included) for my Rainbow Brite cosplay so this is not new for me. If you are going to add to this wig, please keep in mind, it is very time consuming. This is not something to do last minute. I just wish I would've known that the back of the dress was solid, I would have ordered the largest size and altered it to fit and the back would be covered using the extra material. Disguise Costumes, I recommend adding a back view of your items, as the front view alone is very misleading.
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2016

text: It's beautiful but the fit is awkward! I bought it for costume night on a Disney cruise. I had to steam the severe creases before we left home and then repack it to wear on the cruise. The top is saggy and for lots of chest! IT's very low cut. I wore a white tank under and it worked fine. the waist isn't really proportioned well to the chest--the waist is snug. I usually wear a medium and it worked fine--but was snug. The fabric is wonderful and it feels so elegant when wearing! The puffed sleeves are a tad bit itchy wear they hit your arm, but not too bad for a few hours. I'm 5'7" and it was at least 8 inches too long for me! I cut and hemmed it before we left on the cruise so I wouldn't step on it all day. It's a really great quality costume for the price. I've read other reviews that complained about the neckline too I wish they'd change it! It comes with the blue headband and black ribbon for the neck. Buy the gloves separately and you'll feel like a princess!!

text: I bought this for my 10 year old son for his Halloween costume and this was hands down, my greatest (sober) Amazon purchase of all time. He's just shy of the 5 ft mark but it fit him perfectly, with plenty of room to grow. I even wore it to my job (a bank) on Halloween as the office dressed up, and we had clients, coworkers, and even our HR department in hysterics. The only real negatives I noticed (and these are all fairly minor) about this costume is that the battery pack requires a tiny screwdriver (I brought one to work lol), the ventilation in the costume is non-existent (yes, I know it has to be to keep it inflated), and that the batteries die fairly quickly; though I'm sure that could be debatable based on the battery brand used.Now my son and his best friend decided that they were going to terrorize the neighborhood as dinosaurs and his friend got the kids costume (where your face is exposed in the neck of the suit). His friend kept his on ALL night as the ventilation was perfect, but my son would constantly unzip his and walk with his face out - thus ruining the full effect. They ran around for HOURS and we did not notice any wear-and-tear on the tails from the asphalt or rough grounds. They hands down took the neighborhood's 'popular vote' in best costume and had many adults in literal tears as they watched them run up their driveways.This costume is definitely a humorous investment and has been worn numerous times since Halloween. Our dogs hate it, my cat is totally sketched out by it, and my son thinks it's the greatest thing since the X-box One came out.(Also, here's a video of the boys as they approach one house - you can hear the adults losing their minds over the costumes :)[...]
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2016

text: This costume looks great, but I’m confused by the sizing, and the size chart didn’t help. I ordered the “Standard” option, and my costume said “one size” on the package insert. However, it was much too short in both the legs. It was plenty roomy enough in the body, but the feet were up at my upper shins. It was super short in the arms as well, but I think that’s how it’s supposed to be worn, with much of your arms up inside the body of the suit and very little sticking out, since a T-Rex has such short arms.Really weird how short in was in the legs.Super cute though. text: Reminds me of my first sewing project in H.S. Home Ec ... I'm an adult. 5'5", avg wt.,T-Rex feet stopped mid-shin; arms came only halfway too; the shoulders were so narrow I couldn't zip much past my waist & only if I hunched over. There's extra material, but I'm guessing that accommodates inflation. Basically, it's sewn all wrong. Read thru reviews - some people happy, others in the same boat I am, disappointed and returning. Amazon needs to exert MUCH better quality control before wasting everyone's time & money, including their own with defective returns. I'd still reorder if I knew a different vendor who took care to manufacture a decent, sellable product and one FAMILIAR with ADULT U.S. sizing made it. But how in the world would I know that? This one, however, is TRASH! Ruined my Christmas surprise.

text: We purchased this costume based of off its reviews, and we were not disappointed. We wanted to avoid a costume that would fall apart or not match the pictures. The last thing I want to do is have to try to fix something that I spent money on. This costume arrived quickly, and matches the picture. The black material is warm, and the seams are nicely stitched (i.e. won't come apart). The hat is the perfect size for a toddler, without obstructing vision. The sleeves are a tiny bit long for our two year olds, but it still looks nice, and I don't see it being much of a problem because the sleeves are artistically shredded at the ends for effect. The dress goes down to my daughters' feet (one is 38 inches tall and the other is 36) but they should be fine with shoes on. This dress is made well enough to wear more than once (for parades and Halloween) and we will probably keep it out for dress up for the next year or so. If you have twins, and want to coordinate, there is another one in purple...

text: I was absolutely pleased with this outfit when I got it. Unlike a lot of these costumes, this one is longer (hits at my lower thigh and I have LONG legs) and is made of quality material. In other words, you don't look like you just stepped out of a porno (definitely a good thing if you ask me). The dress fits very nicely. I am 5'8", 150 lbs, 36C and I ordered the XL. It fits perfectly and is comfortable. If you like the skin-tight look, don't order a size up. If you want to be comfortable, do.No cuffs, shades, or baton included, just FYI. Dress, belt, hat, two metal badges, and name plate all included.Honestly I almost wish the dress didn't have the police emblems on it...I'd wear it as a "little black dress" if it didn't! It just has a very, very flattering fit--especially for curvy girls!Very pleased over all and looking forward to sporting it!
